title: Toys “R” Us Canada warns customers' info leaked in data breach
summary: Toys "R" Us Canada has sent notices of a data breach to customers informing them of a security incident where threat actors leaked customer records they had previously stolen from its systems.

title: CISA warns of Lanscope Endpoint Manager flaw exploited in attacks
summary: The Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) is warning that hackers are exploiting a critical vulnerability in the Motex Landscope Endpoint Manager.

title: Microsoft disables File Explorer preview for downloads to block attacks
summary: Microsoft says that the File Explorer (formerly Windows Explorer) now automatically blocks previews for files downloaded from the Internet to block credential theft attacks via malicious documents.

title: Zero Trust Has a Blind Spot—Your AI Agents
summary: AI agents now act, decide, and access systems on their own — creating new blind spots Zero Trust can't see. Token Security helps organizations govern AI identities so every agent's access, intent, and action are verified and accountable.

title: Spoofed AI sidebars can trick Atlas, Comet users into dangerous actions
summary: OpenAI's Atlas and Perplexity's Comet browsers are vulnerable to AI sidebar spoofing attacks that mislead users into following fake AI-generated instructions.

title: North Korean Lazarus hackers targeted European defense companies
summary: North Korean Lazarus hackers compromised three European companies in the defense sector through a coordinated Operation DreamJob campaign leveraging fake recruitment lures.

title: Iranian hackers targeted over 100 govt orgs with Phoenix backdoor
summary: State-sponsored Iranian hacker group MuddyWater has targeted more than 100 government entities in attacks that deployed version 4 of the Phoenix backdoor.

title: Pwn2Own Day 2: Hackers exploit 56 zero-days for $790,000
summary: Security researchers collected $792,750 in cash after exploiting 56​​​​​​​ unique zero-day vulnerabilities during the second day of the Pwn2Own Ireland 2025 hacking competition.

title: Hackers exploiting critical "SessionReaper" flaw in Adobe Magento
summary: Hackers are actively exploiting the critical SessionReaper vulnerability (CVE-2025-54236) in Adobe Commerce (formerly Magento) platforms, with hundreds of attempts recorded.

title: TARmageddon flaw in abandoned Rust library enables RCE attacks
summary: A high-severity vulnerability in the now-abandoned async-tar Rust library and its forks can be exploited to gain remote code execution on systems running unpatched software.

title: Meta launches new anti-scam tools for WhatsApp and Messenger
summary: Meta has announced new tools to help WhatsApp and Messenger users protect themselves from potential scams and secure their accounts.

title: FinWise data breach shows why encryption is your last defense
summary: The FinWise breach shows that when insider threats strike, encryption is the last line of defense. Penta Security's D.AMO platform unites encryption, key management, and access control to keep sensitive data secure.

title: PhantomCaptcha ClickFix attack targets Ukraine war relief orgs
summary: A spearphishing attack that lasted a single day targeted members of the Ukrainian regional government administration and organizations critical for the war relief effort in Ukraine, including the International Committee of the Red Cross, UNICEF, and various NGOs.

title: Sharepoint ToolShell attacks targeted orgs across four continents
summary: Hackers believed to be associated with China have leveraged the ToolShell vulnerability (CVE-2025-53770) in Microsoft SharePoint in attacks targeting government agencies, universities, telecommunication service providers, and finance organizations.

title: Vidar Stealer 2.0 adds multi-threaded data theft, better evasion
summary: The operators of Vidar Stealer, one of the most successful malware-as-a-service (MaaS) operations of the past decade, have released a new major version to reflect massive improvements in the malware.

title: TP-Link warns of critical command injection flaw in Omada gateways
summary: TP-Link has made firmware updates available for a broad range of Omada gateway models to address four vulnerabilities, among which a critical pre-auth OS command injection.

title: CISA confirms hackers exploited Oracle E-Business Suite SSRF flaw
summary: CISA has confirmed that an Oracle E-Business Suite flaw tracked as CVE-2025-61884 is being exploited in attacks, adding it to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog.

title: Cursor, Windsurf IDEs riddled with 94+ n-day Chromium vulnerabilities
summary: The latest releases of Cursor and Windsurf integrated development environments are vulnerable to more than 94 known and patched security issues in the Chromium browser and the V8 JavaScript engine.

title: Hackers exploit 34 zero-days on first day of Pwn2Own Ireland
summary: On the first day of Pwn2Own Ireland 2025, security researchers exploited 34 unique zero-days and collected $522,500 in cash awards.

title: Russian hackers evolve malware pushed in "I am not a robot" captchas
summary: The Russian state-backed Star Blizzard hacker group has ramped up operations with new, constantly evolving malware families (NoRobot, MaybeRobot) deployed in complex delivery chains that start with ClickFix social engineering attacks.

title: Maximizing gateway security: Beyond the basic configuration
summary: Gateways can do more than route traffic, they can also strengthen your entire security posture. Learn how NordLayer combines ZTNA, firewalls, and private gateways to secure hybrid teams and keep networks compliant.

title: DNS0.EU private DNS service shuts down over sustainability issues
summary: The DNS0.EU non-profit public DNS service focused on European users announced its immediate shut down due to time and resource constraints.

title: Retail giant Muji halts online sales after ransomware attack on supplier
summary: Japanese retail company Muji has taken offline its store due to a logistics outage caused by a ransomware attack at its delivery partner, Askul.

title: Over 75,000 WatchGuard security devices vulnerable to critical RCE
summary: Nearly 76,000 WatchGuard Firebox network security appliances are exposed on the public web and still vulnerable to a critical issue (CVE-2025-9242) that could allow a remote attacker to execute code without authentication.

title: CISA: High-severity Windows SMB flaw now exploited in attacks
summary: CISA says threat actors are now actively exploiting a high-severity Windows SMB privilege escalation vulnerability that can let them gain SYSTEM privileges on unpatched systems.

title: Self-spreading GlassWorm malware hits OpenVSX,  VS Code registries
summary: A new and ongoing supply-chain attack is targeting developers on the OpenVSX and Microsoft Visual Studio marketplaces with self-spreading malware called GlassWorm that has been installed an estimated 35,800 times.

title: Microsoft warns of Windows smart card auth issues after October updates
summary: Microsoft says the October 2025 Windows security updates are causing smart card authentication and certificate issues due to a change designed to strengthen the Windows Cryptographic Services.

title: Find hidden malicious OAuth apps in Microsoft 365 using Cazadora
summary: Malicious OAuth apps can hide inside Microsoft 365 tenants. Huntress Labs' Cazadora script helps uncover rogue apps before they lead to a breach. Dive deeper in their Tradecraft Tuesday sessions.

title: TikTok videos continue to push infostealers in ClickFix attacks
summary: Cybercriminals are using TikTok videos disguised as free activation guides for popular software like Windows, Spotify, and Netflix to spread information-stealing malware.

title: Google ads for fake Homebrew, LogMeIn sites push infostealers
summary: A new malicious campaign is targeting macOS developers with fake Homebrew, LogMeIn, and TradingView platforms that deliver infostealing malware like AMOS (Atomic macOS Stealer) and Odyssey.

title: ConnectWise fixes Automate bug allowing AiTM update attacks
summary: ConnectWise released a security update to address vulnerabilities, one of them with critical severity, in Automate product that could expose sensitive communications to interception and modification.

title: American Airlines subsidiary Envoy confirms Oracle data theft attack
summary: Envoy Air, a regional airline carrier owned by American Airlines, confirms that data was compromised from its Oracle E-Business Suite application after the Clop extortion gang listed American Airlines on its data leak site.

title: Europol dismantles SIM box operation renting numbers for cybercrime
summary: European law enforcement in an operation codenamed 'SIMCARTEL' has dismantled an illegal SIM-box service that enabled more than 3,200 fraud cases and caused at least 4.5 million euros in losses.

title: Microsoft fixes highest-severity ASP.NET Core flaw ever
summary: Earlier this week, Microsoft patched a vulnerability that was flagged with the "highest ever" severity rating received by an ASP.NET Core security flaw.

title: VMware Certification: Your Next Career Power Move
summary: VMware certification isn't just about passing exams — it's about mastering systems, proving expertise, and your career. Gain hands-on labs, discounts, and mentorship with VMUG Advantage to reach your next goal faster.

title: Over 266,000 F5 BIG-IP instances exposed to remote attacks
summary: Internet security nonprofit Shadowserver Foundation has found more than 266,000 F5 BIG-IP instances exposed online after the security breach disclosed by cybersecurity company F5 this week.

title: Auction giant Sotheby’s says data breach exposed financial information
summary: Major international auction house Sotheby's is notifying individuals of a data breach incident on its systems where threat actors stole sensitive information, including financial details.

title: Have I Been Pwned: Prosper data breach impacts 17.6 million accounts
summary: Hackers stole the personal information of over 17.6 million people after breaching the systems of financial services company Prosper.

title: Hackers exploit Cisco SNMP flaw to deploy rootkit on switches
summary: Threat actors exploited a recently patched remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2025-20352) in Cisco networking devices to deploy a rootkit and target unprotected Linux systems.

title: Microsoft disrupts ransomware attacks targeting Teams users
summary: Microsoft has disrupted a wave of Rhysida ransomware attacks in early October by revoking over 200 certificates used to sign malicious Teams installers.

title: Gladinet fixes actively exploited zero-day in file-sharing software
summary: Gladinet has released security updates for its CentreStack business solution to address a local file inclusion vulnerability (CVE-2025-11371) that threat actors have leveraged as a zero-day since late September.

title: CISA: Maximum-severity Adobe flaw now exploited in attacks
summary: CISA has warned that attackers are actively exploiting a maximum-severity vulnerability in Adobe Experience Manager to execute code on unpatched systems.

title: Unified Exposure Management Platforms: The Future of Preemptive Cyber Defense
summary: Traditional MDR focuses on reacting to attacks already in motion — but modern threats demand prevention. Picus Security explains how Unified Exposure Management Platforms continuously identifies, validates, and fixes exploitable risks before adversaries strike.

title: North Korean hackers use EtherHiding to hide malware on the blockchain
summary: North Korean hackers were observed employing the 'EtherHiding' tactic to deliver malware, steal cryptocurrency, and perform espionage with stealth and resilience.

title: Microsoft debuts Copilot Actions for agentic AI-driven Windows tasks
summary: Microsoft announced today a new Windows 11 Copilot feature called Copilot Actions that enables AI agents to perform real tasks on local files and applications.

title: Microsoft adds Copilot voice activation on Windows 11 PCs
summary: Microsoft says Windows 11 users can now start a conversation with the AI-powered Copilot digital assistant by saying the "Hey Copilot" wake word.

title: Capita to pay £14 million for data breach impacting 6.6 million people
summary: The Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) in the UK has fined Capita, a provider of data-driven business process services, £14 million ($18.7 million) for a data breach incident in 2023 that exposed the personal information of 6.6 million people.

title: PowerSchool hacker gets sentenced to four years in prison
summary: 19-year-old college student Matthew D. Lane, from Worcester, Massachusetts, was sentenced to 4 years in prison for orchestrating a cyberattack on PowerSchool in December 2024 that resulted in a massive data breach.

title: Fake LastPass, Bitwarden breach alerts lead to PC hijacks
summary: An ongoing phishing campaign is targeting LastPass and Bitwarden users with fake emails claiming that the companies were hacked, urging them to download a supposedly more secure desktop version of the password manager.

title: F5 releases BIG-IP patches for stolen security vulnerabilities
summary: Cybersecurity company F5 has released security updates to address BIG-IP vulnerabilities stolen in a breach detected on August 9, 2025.

title: Clothing giant MANGO discloses data breach exposing customer info
summary: Spanish fashion retailer MANGO is sending notices of a data breach to its customers, warning that its marketing vendor suffered a compromise exposing personal data.

title: How to spot dark web threats on your network using NDR
summary: Dark web activity can hide in plain sight within everyday network traffic. Corelight's NDR platform brings deep visibility, AI-driven detection, and behavioral analytics to uncover hidden threats across your network.

title: F5 says hackers stole undisclosed BIG-IP flaws, source code
summary: U.S. cybersecurity company F5 disclosed that nation-state hackers breached its systems and stole undisclosed BIG-IP security vulnerabilities and source code.

title: Malicious crypto-stealing VSCode extensions resurface on OpenVSX
summary: A threat actor called TigerJack is constantly targeting developers with malicious extensions published on Microsoft's Visual Code (VSCode) marketplace and OpenVSX registry to steal cryptocurrency and plant backdoors.

title: New Android Pixnapping attack steals MFA codes pixel-by-pixel
summary: A new side-channel attack called Pixnapping enables a malicious Android app with no permissions to extract sensitive data by stealing pixels displayed by applications or websites, and reconstructing them to derive the content.

title: Microsoft October 2025 Patch Tuesday fixes 6 zero-days, 172 flaws
summary: Today is Microsoft's October 2025 Patch Tuesday, which includes security updates for 172 flaws, including six zero-day vulnerabilities. Get patching!

title: US seizes $15 billion in crypto from 'pig butchering' kingpin
summary: The U.S. Department of Justice has seized $15 billion in bitcoin from the leader of Prince Group, a criminal organization that stole billions of dollars from victims in the United States through cryptocurrency investment scams, also known as romance baiting or pig butchering.

title: Oracle silently fixes zero-day exploit leaked by ShinyHunters
summary: Oracle has silently fixed an Oracle E-Business Suite vulnerability (CVE-2025-61884) that was actively exploited to breach servers, with a proof-of-concept exploit publicly leaked by the ShinyHunters extortion group.

title: Security firms dispute credit for overlapping CVE reports
summary: FuzzingLabs has accused the YCombinator-backed startup, Gecko Security, of replicating its vulnerability disclosures. Gecko allegedly filed for 2 CVEs based on FuzzingLabs' reports without crediting them. Gecko denies any wrongdoing, calling the allegations a misunderstanding over disclosure process.

title: When AI Agents Join the Teams: The Hidden Security Shifts No One Expects
summary: AI assistants are no longer just helping — they're acting. Autonomous agents now open tickets, fix incidents, and make decisions faster than humans can monitor. As "Shadow AI" spreads, learn from Token Security why orgs must govern these agents like powerful new identities before oversight disappears.

title: Secure Boot bypass risk threatens nearly 200,000 Linux Framework laptops
summary: Around 200,000 Linux computer systems from American computer maker Framework were shipped with signed UEFI shell components that could be exploited to bypass Secure Boot protections.

title: Chinese hackers abuse geo-mapping tool for year-long persistence
summary: Chinese state hackers remained undetected in a target environment for more than a year by turning a component in the ArcGIS geo-mapping tool into a web shell.

title: Microsoft restricts IE mode access in Edge after zero-day attacks
summary: Microsoft is restricting access to Internet Explorer mode in Edge browser after learning that hackers are leveraging zero-day exploits in the Chakra JavaScript engine for access to target devices.

title: SimonMed says 1.2 million patients impacted in January data breach
summary: U.S. medical imaging provider SimonMed Imaging is notifying more than 1.2 million individuals of a data breach that exposed their sensitive information.

title: Massive multi-country botnet targets RDP services in the US
summary: A large-scale botnet is targeting Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) services in the United States from more than 100,000 IP addresses.

title: SonicWall VPN accounts breached using stolen creds in widespread attacks
summary: Researchers warn that threat actors have compromised more than a hundred SonicWall SSLVPN accounts in a large-scale campaign using stolen, valid credentials.

title: Oracle releases emergency patch for new E-Business Suite flaw
summary: Oracle has issued an emergency security update over the weekend to patch another E-Business Suite (EBS) vulnerability that can be exploited remotely by unauthenticated attackers.

title: Meet Varonis Interceptor: AI-Native Email Security
summary: AI-generated phishing and social engineering attacks outpace traditional email defenses. Varonis' new Interceptor platform uses multimodal AI — vision, language, and behavior models — to detect zero-hour attacks and stop them before they reach users.

title: Harvard investigating breach linked to Oracle zero-day exploit
summary: Harvard University is investigating a data breach after the Clop ransomware gang listed the school on its data leak site, saying the alleged breach was likely caused by a recently disclosed zero-day vulnerability in Oracle's E-Business Suite servers.

title: Fake 'Inflation Refund' texts target New Yorkers in new scam
summary: An ongoing smishing campaign is targeting New Yorkers with text messages posing as the Department of Taxation and Finance, claiming to offer "Inflation Refunds" in an attempt to steal victims' personal and financial data.

title: Spain dismantles “GXC Team” cybercrime syndicate, arrests leader
summary: Spanish Guardia Civil have dismantled the "GXC Team" cybercrime syndicate and arrested its alleged leader, a 25-year-old Brazilian known as "GoogleXcoder."

title: Hackers exploiting zero-day in Gladinet file sharing software
summary: Threat actors are exploiting a zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2025-11371) in Gladinet CentreStack and Triofox products, which allows a local attacker to access system files without authentication.

title: Cybersecurity For Dummies, 3rd Edition eBook FREE for a Limited Time
summary: In today's hyper-connected world, cyber threats are more sophisticated and frequent than ever - ransomware, data breaches, and social engineering scams, targeting everyone from individuals to Fortune 500 companies. Right now, you can grab "Cybersecurity For Dummies, 3rd Edition" - a $29.99 value - completely FREE for a limited time.

title: Apple now offers $2 million for zero-click RCE vulnerabilities
summary: Apple is announcing a major expansion and redesign of its bug bounty program, doubling maximum payouts, adding new research categories, and introducing a more transparent reward structure.

title: From Lab to Leadership: How VMware Certification Transformed My Career
summary: From lab work to leadership — VMware certification can transform your IT career. Learn from VMware User Group (VMUG) how the VMUG Advantage can help you build real skills, gain confidence, and join a global IT community.

title: FBI takes down BreachForums portal used for Salesforce extortion
summary: The FBI has seized last night all domains for the BreachForums hacking forum operated by the ShinyHunters group mostly as a portal for leaking corporate data stolen in attacks from ransomware and extortion gangs.

title: New Android spyware ClayRat imitates WhatsApp, TikTok, YouTube
summary: A new Android spyware called ClayRat is luring potential victims by posing as popular apps and services like WhatsApp, Google Photos, TikTok, and YouTube.

title: Microsoft: Hackers target universities in “payroll pirate” attacks
summary: A cybercrime gang tracked as Storm-2657 has been targeting university employees in the United States to hijack salary payments in "pirate payroll" attacks since March 2025.

title: Hackers now use Velociraptor DFIR tool in ransomware attacks
summary: Threat actors have started to use the Velociraptor digital forensics and incident response (DFIR) tool in attacks that deploy LockBit and Babuk ransomware.

title: RondoDox botnet targets 56 n-day flaws in worldwide attacks
summary: A new large-scale botnet called RondoDox is targeting 56 vulnerabilities in more than 30 distinct devices, including flaws first disclosed during Pwn2Own hacking competitions.

title: SonicWall: Firewall configs stolen for all cloud backup customers
summary: SonicWall has confirmed that all customers that used the company's cloud backup service are affected by the security breach last month.

title: From infostealer to full RAT: dissecting the PureRAT attack chain
summary: Researchers map a campaign that escalated from a Python infostealer to a full PureRAT backdoor — loaders, evasions, and TLS-pinned C2. Join Huntress Labs' Tradecraft Tuesday for deep technical walkthroughs and live IOC guidance on the latest cybersecurity topics.

title: Hacktivists target critical infrastructure, hit decoy plant
summary: A pro-Russian hacktivist group called TwoNet pivoted in less than a year from launching distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks to targeting critical infrastructure.

title: Hackers claim Discord breach exposed data of 5.5 million users
summary: Discord says they will not be negotiating with threat actors who claim to have stolen the data of 5.5 million unique users from the company's Zendesk support system instance, including government IDs and partial payment information for some people.

title: New FileFix attack uses cache smuggling to evade security software
summary: A new variant of the FileFix social engineering attack uses cache smuggling to secretly download a malicious ZIP archive onto a victim's system and bypassing security software.

title: Qilin ransomware claims Asahi brewery attack, leaks data
summary: The Qilin ransomware group has claimed responsibility for the attack at Japanese beer maker Asahi, adding the company to its extortion page on the dark web yesterday.

title: Crimson Collective hackers target AWS cloud instances for data theft
summary: The 'Crimson Collective' threat group has been targeting AWS (Amazon Web Services) cloud environments for the past weeks, to steal data and extort companies.

title: Hackers exploit auth bypass in Service Finder WordPress theme
summary: Threat actors are actively exploiting a critical vulnerability in the Service Finder WordPress theme that allows them to bypass authentication and log in as administrators.

title: London police arrests suspects linked to nursery breach, child doxing
summary: The UK Metropolitan Police has arrested two suspects following an investigation into the doxing of children online after a ransomware attack on a chain of London-based nurseries.

title: Defend the Target, Not Just the Door: A Modern Plan for Google Workspace
summary: The Salesloft Drift breach shows attackers don't need to "hack Google" — they just need to breach a trusted integration. Learn from Material Security how to secure OAuth, detect risky behavior, and protect data in Google Workspace.

title: Salesforce refuses to pay ransom over widespread data theft attacks
summary: Salesforce has confirmed that it will not negotiate with or pay a ransom to the threat actors behind a massive wave of data theft attacks that impacted the company's customers this year.

title: Docker makes Hardened Images Catalog affordable for small businesses
summary: The Docker team has announced unlimited access to its Hardened Images catalog to make access to secure software bundles affordable for all development teams at startups and SMBs.

title: Google won’t fix new ASCII smuggling attack in Gemini
summary: Google has decided not to fix a new ASCII smuggling attack in Gemini that could be used to trick the AI assistant into providing users with fake information, alter the model's behavior, and silently poison its data.

title: DraftKings warns of account breaches in credential stuffing attacks
summary: Sports betting giant DraftKings has notified an undisclosed number of customers that their accounts had been hacked in a recent wave of credential stuffing attacks.

title: Clop exploited Oracle zero-day for data theft since early August
summary: The Clop ransomware gang has been exploiting a critical Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) zero-day bug in data theft attacks since at least early August, according to cybersecurity company CrowdStrike.

title: Electronics giant Avnet confirms breach, says stolen data unreadable
summary: Electronic components distributor Avnet confirmed in a statement for BleepingComputer that it suffered a data breach but noted that the stolen data is unreadable without proprietary tools.

title: Redefining Security Validation with AI-Powered Breach and Attack Simulation
summary: Security teams are drowning in threat intel — but AI is changing that. AI-powered Breach and Attack Simulation turns new threats into real, testable scenarios in minutes — delivering proof that your defenses work, not just assumptions. Join the BAS Summit 2025 to see how AI redefines security validation.

title: Google's new AI bug bounty program pays up to $30,000 for flaws
summary: This week, Google has launched an AI Vulnerability Reward Program dedicated to security researchers who find and report flaws in the company's AI systems.

title: Red Hat data breach escalates as ShinyHunters joins extortion
summary: Enterprise software giant Red Hat is now being extorted by the ShinyHunters gang, with samples of stolen customer engagement reports (CERs) leaked on their data leak site.

title: Microsoft: Critical GoAnywhere bug exploited in ransomware attacks
summary: A cybercrime group, tracked as Storm-1175, has been actively exploiting a maximum severity GoAnywhere MFT vulnerability in Medusa ransomware attacks for nearly a month.

title: Zeroday Cloud hacking contest offers $4.5 million in bounties
summary: A new hacking competition called Zeroday Cloud, focused on open-source cloud and AI tools, announced a total prize pool of $4.5 million in bug bounties for researchers that submit exploits for various targets.

title: Redis warns of critical flaw impacting thousands of instances
summary: The Redis security team has released patches for a maximum severity vulnerability that could allow attackers to gain remote code execution on thousands of vulnerable instances.

title: The role of Artificial Intelligence in today’s cybersecurity landscape
summary: AI is transforming cybersecurity—from detecting phishing and insider threats to accelerating response. See how Waziuh, the open-source XDR and SIEM, integrates AI to turn raw security data into actionable insights and smarter threat hunting.

title: Steam and Microsoft warn of Unity flaw exposing gamers to attacks
summary: A code execution vulnerability in the Unity game engine could be exploited to achieve code execution on Android and privilege escalation on Windows.

title: XWorm malware resurfaces with ransomware module, over 35 plugins
summary: New versions of the XWorm backdoor are being distributed in phishing campaigns after the original developer, XCoder, abandoned the project last year.

title: Oracle patches EBS zero-day exploited in Clop data theft attacks
summary: Oracle is warning about a critical E-Business Suite zero-day vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-61882 that allows attackers to perform unauthenticated remote code execution, with the flaw actively exploited in Clop data theft attacks.

title: Hackers exploited Zimbra flaw as zero-day using iCalendar files
summary: Researchers monitoring for larger .ICS calendar attachments found that a flaw in Zimbra Collaboration Suite (ZCS) was used in zero-day attacks at the beginning of the year.

title: ParkMobile pays... $1 each for 2021 data breach that hit 22 million
summary: ParkMobile has finally wrapped up a class action lawsuit over the platform's 2021 data breach that hit 22 million users. But there's a catch: victims are receiving compensation in the form of a $1 in-app credit, which they must claim manually. And, it comes with an expiration date.

title: Massive surge in scans targeting Palo Alto Networks login portals
summary: A spike in suspicious scans targeting Palo Alto Networks login portals indicates clear reconnaissance efforts from suspicious IP addresses, researchers warn.

title: Discord discloses data breach after hackers steal support tickets
summary: Hackers stole partial payment information and personally identifiable data, including names and government-issued IDs, from some Discord users after compromising a third-party customer service provider.

title: Signal adds new cryptographic defense against quantum attacks
summary: Signal announced the introduction of Sparse Post-Quantum Ratchet (SPQR), a new cryptographic component designed to withstand quantum computing threats.

title: Renault and Dacia UK warn of data breach impacting customers
summary: Customers of Renault and Dacia in the United Kingdom have been notified that sensitive information they shared with the car maker was compromised following a data breach at a third-party provider.

title: Japanese beer giant Asahi confirms ransomware attack
summary: Japanese beer-making giant Asahi has disclosed today that a ransomware attack caused the IT disruptions that forced it to shut down factories this week.

title: ShinyHunters launches Salesforce data leak site to extort 39 victims
summary: An extortion group has launched a new data leak site to publicly extort dozens of companies impacted by a wave of Salesforce breaches, leaking samples of data stolen in the attacks.

title: CommetJacking attack tricks Comet browser into stealing emails
summary: A new attack called 'CometJacking' exploits URL parameters to pass to Perplexity's Comet AI browser hidden instructions that allow access to sensitive data from connected services, like email and calendar.

title: Presenting AI to the Board as a CISO? Here’s a Template.
summary: Boards want answers on AI: Where is it used? What risks does it create? How is it governed? Keep Aware released a free template to help CISOs present GenAI adoption, risk, exposure & controls clearly to leadership.

title: Oracle links Clop extortion attacks to July 2025 vulnerabilities
summary: Oracle has linked an ongoing extortion campaign claimed by the Clop ransomware gang to E-Business Suite (EBS) vulnerabilities that were patched in July 2025.

title: Gmail business users can now send encrypted emails to anyone
summary: Google says that Gmail enterprise users can now send end-to-end encrypted emails to people who use any email service or platform.

title: Microsoft Outlook stops displaying inline SVG images used in attacks
summary: Microsoft says Outlook for Web and the new Outlook for Windows will no longer display risky inline SVG images that are being used in attacks.

title: DrayTek warns of remote code execution bug in Vigor routers
summary: Networking hardware maker DrayTek released an advisory to warn about a security vulnerability in several Vigor router models that could allow remote, unauthenticated actors to execute perform arbitrary code.

title: HackerOne paid $81 million in bug bounties over the past year
summary: Bug bounty platform HackerOne announced that it paid out $81 million in rewards to white-hat hackers worldwide over the past 12 months.

title: Microsoft Defender bug triggers erroneous BIOS update alerts
summary: ​Microsoft is working to resolve a bug that causes Defender for Endpoint to incorrectly tag some devices' BIOS (Basic Input/Output System) firmware as outdated, prompting users to update it.

title: Your Service Desk is the New Attack Vector—Here's How to Defend It.
summary: Service desks are prime targets. A practical, NIST-aligned workflow for help desk user verification that stops social engineering without slowing support. Learn how role- & points-based verification workflows stop attackers cold.

title: Android spyware campaigns impersonate Signal and ToTok messengers
summary: Two new spyware campaigns that researchers call ProSpy and ToSpy lured Android users with fake upgrades or plugins for the Signal and ToTok messaging apps to steal sensitive data.

title: Red Hat confirms security incident after hackers breach GitLab instance
summary: An extortion group calling itself the Crimson Collective claims to have stolen nearly 570GB of compressed data across 28,000 internal development respositories belonging to Red Hat, with the company confirming it was a breach of one of its GitLab instances.

title: Clop extortion emails claim theft of Oracle E-Business Suite data
summary: Mandiant and Google are tracking a new extortion campaign where executives at multiple companies received emails claiming that sensitive data was stolen from their Oracle E-Business Suite systems

title: Data breach at dealership software provider impacts 766k clients
summary: A ransomware attack at Motility Software Solutions, a provider of dealer management software (DMS), has exposed the sensitive data of 766,000 customers.

title: Adobe Analytics bug leaked customer tracking data to other tenants
summary: Adobe is warning its Analytics customers that an ingestion bug caused data from some organizations to appear in the analytics instances of others for approximately one day.

title: Android malware uses VNC to give attackers hands-on access
summary: A new Android banking and remote access trojan (RAT) dubbed Klopatra disguised as an IPTV and VPN app has infected more than 3,000 devices across Europe.

title: F-Droid project threatened by Google's new dev registration rules
summary: F-Droid is warning that the project could reach an end due to Google's new requirements for all Android developers to verify their identity.

title: WestJet data breach exposes travel details of 1.2 million customers
summary: Canadian airline WestJet is informing customers that the cyberattack disclosed in June compromised the personal information of 1.2 million customers, including passports and ID documents.

title: Google Drive for desktop gets AI-powered ransomware detection
summary: Google has begun rolling out a new AI-powered security feature for Google Drive desktop, which will automatically pause file syncing when it detects a ransomware attack to minimize impact.

title: Allianz Life says July data breach impacts 1.5 million people
summary: Allianz Life has completed the investigation into the cyberattack it suffered in July and determined that nearly 1.5 million individuals are impacted.

title: How To Simplify CISA's Zero Trust Roadmap with Modern Microsegmentation
summary: CISA says microsegmentation isn't optional—it's foundational to Zero Trust. But legacy methods make it slow & complex. Learn from Zero Networks how modern, automated, agentless approaches make containment practical for every org.

title: New MatrixPDF toolkit turns PDFs into phishing and malware lures
summary: A new phishing and malware distribution toolkit called MatrixPDF allows attackers to convert ordinary PDF files into interactive lures that bypass email security and redirect victims to credential theft or malware downloads.

title: Nearly 50,000 Cisco firewalls vulnerable to actively exploited flaws
summary: Roughly 50,000 Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) and Firewall Threat Defense (FTD) appliances exposed on the public web are vulnerable to two vulnerabilities actively leveraged by hackers.

title: Critical WD My Cloud bug allows remote command injection
summary: Western Digital has released firmware updates for multiple My Cloud NAS models to patch a critical-severity vulnerability that could be exploited remotely to execute arbitrary system commands.

title: Chinese hackers exploiting VMware zero-day since October 2024

title: France slaps Google with €325M fine for violating cookie regulations

title: 6 browser-based attacks all security teams should be ready for in 2025
summary: The browser is now the frontline for cyberattacks. From phishing kits and ClickFix lures to malicious OAuth apps and extensions, attackers are targeting the very place your employees access business-critical apps. Push Security explains how to defend where breaches begin.

title: Tire giant Bridgestone confirms cyberattack impacts manufacturing
summary: Car tire giant Bridgestone confirms it is investigating a cyberattack that impacts the operation of some manufacturing facilities in North America.

title: Microsoft says recent Windows updates cause app install issues
summary: Microsoft says the August 2025 security updates are triggering unexpected User Account Control (UAC) prompts and app installation issues for non-admin users across all supported Windows versions.

title: Threat actors abuse X’s Grok AI to spread malicious links
summary: Threat actors are using Grok, X's built-in AI assistant, to bypass link posting restrictions that the platform introduced to reduce malicious advertising.

title: US offers $10 million bounty for info on Russian FSB hackers
summary: The U.S. Department of State is offering a reward of up to $10 million for information on three Russian Federal Security Service (FSB) officers involved in cyberattacks targeting U.S. critical infrastructure organizations on behalf of the Russian government.

title: Hackers use new HexStrike-AI tool to rapidly exploit n-day flaws
summary: Hackers are increasingly using a new AI-powered offensive security framework called HexStrike-AI in real attacks to exploit newly disclosed n-day flaws.

title: US sues robot toy maker for exposing children's data to Chinese devs
summary: The U.S. Department of Justice has sued toy maker Apitor Technology for allegedly allowing a Chinese third party to collect children's geolocation data without their knowledge and parental consent.

title: Police disrupts Streameast, largest pirated sports streaming network
summary: The Alliance for Creativity and Entertainment (ACE) and Egyptian authorities have shut down Streameast, the world's largest illegal live sports streaming network, and arrested two people allegedly associated with the operation.

title: SaaS giant Workiva discloses data breach after Salesforce attack
summary: Workiva, a leading cloud-based SaaS (Software as a Service) provider, notified its customers that attackers who gained access to a third-party customer relationship management (CRM) system stole some of their data.

title: Google fixes actively exploited Android flaws in September update
summary: Google has released the September 2025 security update for Android devices, addressing a total of 84 vulnerabilities, including two actively exploited flaws.

title: Disney to pay $10M to settle claims it collected kids’ data on YouTube
summary: Disney will pay $10 million to settle claims by the U.S. Federal Trade Commission that it mislabeled videos for children on YouTube, which allowed the collection of kids' personal information without their consent or notification to their parents.

title: They know where you are: Cybersecurity and the shadow world of geolocation
summary: Geolocation is the invisible attack vector. From Stuxnet to today's APTs, malware now lies dormant until it hits the right place—turning location data into a weapon. Acronis' TRU explains why defenses must evolve beyond VPNs and perimeter controls.

title: Hackers breach fintech firm in attempted $130M bank heist
summary: Hackers tried to steal $130 million from Evertec's Brazilian subsidiary Sinqia S.A.after gaining unauthorized access to its environment on the central bank's real-time payment system (Pix).

title: Cloudflare hit by data breach in Salesloft Drift supply chain attack
summary: Cloudflare is the latest company impacted in a recent string of Salesloft Drift breaches, part of a supply-chain attack disclosed last week.

title: Cloudflare blocks largest recorded DDoS attack peaking at 11.5 Tbps
summary: Internet infrastructure company Cloudflare said it recently blocked the largest recorded volumetric distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack, which peaked at 11.5 terabits per second (Tbps).

title: Jaguar Land Rover says cyberattack ‘severely disrupted’ production
summary: Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) announced that a cyberattack forced the company to shut down certain systems as part of the mitigation effort.

title: Pennsylvania AG Office says ransomware attack behind recent outage
summary: The Office of the Pennsylvania Attorney General announced that a ransomware attack is behind the ongoing two-week service outage.

title: Palo Alto Networks data breach exposes customer info, support cases
summary: Palo Alto Networks suffered a data breach that exposed customer data and support cases after attackers abused compromised OAuth tokens from the Salesloft Drift breach to access its Salesforce instance.

title: Zscaler data breach exposes customer info after Salesloft Drift compromise
summary: Cybersecurity company Zscaler warns it suffered a data breach after threat actors gained access to its Salesforce instance and stole customer information, including the contents of support cases.

title: Amazon disrupts Russian APT29 hackers targeting Microsoft 365
summary: Researchers have disrupted an operation attributed to Russian state-sponsored threat group Midnight Blizzard, who sought access to Microsoft 365 accounts and data.

title: Brokewell Android malware delivered through fake TradingView ads
summary: Cybercriminals are abusing Meta's advertising platforms with fake offers of a free TradingView Premium app that spreads the Brokewell malware for Android.

title: TamperedChef infostealer delivered through fraudulent PDF Editor
summary: Threat actors have been using multiple websites promoted through Google ads to distribute a convincing PDF editing app that delivers an info-stealing malware called TamperedChef.

title: WhatsApp patches vulnerability exploited in zero-day attacks
summary: WhatsApp has patched a security vulnerability in its iOS and macOS messaging clients that was exploited in targeted zero-day attacks.

title: Microsoft to enforce MFA for Azure resource management in October
summary: Starting in October, Microsoft will enforce multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all Azure resource management actions to protect Azure clients from unauthorized access attempts.

title: Google warns Salesloft breach impacted some Workspace accounts
summary: Google reports that the Salesloft Drift breach is larger than initially thought, warning that attackers also used stolen OAuth tokens to access Google Workspace email accounts in addition to Salesforce data.

title: Malware devs abuse Anthropic’s Claude AI to build ransomware
summary: Anthropic's Claude Code large language model has been abused by threat actors who used it in data extortion campaigns and to develop ransomware packages.

title: Passwordstate dev urges users to patch auth bypass vulnerability
summary: Click Studios, the company behind the Passwordstate enterprise-grade password manager, has warned customers to patch a high-severity authentication bypass vulnerability as soon as possible.

title: Police seize VerifTools fake ID marketplace servers, domains
summary: The FBI and the Dutch Police have shut down the VerifTools marketplace for fraudulent identity documents after seizing servers in Amsterdam that hosted the online operation.

title: MATLAB dev says ransomware gang stole data of 10,000 people
summary: MathWorks, a leading developer of mathematical simulation and computing software, revealed that a ransomware gang stole the data of over 10,000 people after breaching its network in April.

title: Shadow IT Is Expanding Your Attack Surface. Here’s Proof
summary: Shadow IT isn't theoretical—it's everywhere. Intruder uncovered exposed backups, open Git repos, and admin panels in just days, all hiding sensitive data. Make your hidden assets visible before attackers do.

title: TransUnion suffers data breach impacting over 4.4 million people

title: Storm-0501 hackers shift to ransomware attacks in the cloud
summary: Microsoft warns that a threat actor tracked as Storm-0501 has evolved its operations, shifting away from encrypting devices with ransomware to focusing on cloud-based encryption, data theft, and extortion.

title: Experimental PromptLock ransomware uses AI to encrypt, steal data
summary: Threat researchers discovered the first AI-powered ransomware, called PromptLock, that uses Lua scripts to steal and encrypt data on Windows, macOS, and Linux systems.

title: FreePBX servers hacked via zero-day, emergency fix released
summary: The Sangoma FreePBX Security Team is warning about an actively exploited FreePBX zero-day vulnerability that impacts systems with the Administrator Control Panel (ACP) is exposed to the internet.

title: IT system supplier cyberattack impacts 200 municipalities in Sweden
summary: A cyberattack on Miljödata, an IT systems supplier for roughly 80% of Sweden's municipal systems, has caused accessibility problems in more than 200 regions of the country.

title: Global Salt Typhoon hacking campaigns linked to Chinese tech firms
summary: The U.S. National Security Agency (NSA), the UK's National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC), and partners from over a dozen countries have linked the Salt Typhoon global hacking campaigns to three China-based technology firms.

title: Over 28,000 Citrix devices vulnerable to new exploited RCE flaw
summary: More than 28,200 Citrix instances are vulnerable to a critical remote code execution vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-7775 that is already being exploited in the wild.

title: Why zero trust is never 'done' and is an ever-evolving process
summary: Zero trust isn't a project you finish—it's a cycle that keeps evolving. From supply chain exploits to policy drift, resilience requires continuous testing and adaptation. Learn how Specops Software supports this journey with tools that make it easier.

title: Healthcare Services Group data breach impacts 624,000 people
summary: The Healthcare Services Group (HSGI) is alerting more than 600,000 individuals that their personal information was exposed in a security breach last year.

title: Google to verify all Android devs to protect users from malware
summary: Google is introducing a new defense for Android called 'Developer Verification' to block malware installations from sideloaded apps sourced from outside the official Google Play app store.

title: Citrix fixes critical NetScaler RCE flaw exploited in zero-day attacks
summary: Citrix fixed three NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway flaws today, including a critical remote code execution flaw tracked as CVE-2025-7775 that was actively exploited in attacks as a zero-day vulnerability.

title: Mustang Panda hackers hijack network captive portals in diplomat attacks
summary: State-sponsored hackers linked to the Mustang Panda activity cluster targeted diplomats by hijacking web traffic to redirect to a malware serving website.

title: Salesloft breached to steal OAuth tokens for Salesforce data-theft attacks
summary: Hackers breached sales automation platform Salesloft to steal OAuth and refresh tokens from its Drift chat agent integration with Salesforce to pivot to customer environments and exfiltrate data. The ShinyHunters extortion group claims responsibility for these additional Salesforce attacks.

title: Nevada closes state offices as cyberattack disrupts IT systems
summary: Nevada remains two days into a cyberattack that began early Sunday, disrupting government websites, phone systems, and online platforms, and forcing all state offices to close on Monday.

title: CISA warns of actively exploited Git code execution flaw
summary: The U.S. Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) is warning of hackers exploiting an arbitrary code execution flaw in the Git distributed version control system.

title: Beyond GDPR security training: Turning regulation into opportunity
summary: Discover how GDPR compliance can spark real growth and give you a competitive advantage with practical strategies and a strong security culture.

title: Nissan confirms design studio data breach claimed by Qilin ransomware
summary: Nissan Japan has confirmed to BleepingComputer that it suffered a data breach following unauthorized access to a server of one of its subsidiaries, Creative Box Inc. (CBI).

title: Surge in coordinated scans targets Microsoft RDP auth servers
summary: Internet intelligence firm GreyNoise reports that it has recorded a significant spike in scanning activity consisting of nearly 1,971 IP addresses probing Microsoft Remote Desktop Web Access and RDP Web Client authentication portals in unison, suggesting a coordinated reconnaissance campaign.

title: New AI attack hides data-theft prompts in downscaled images
summary: Researchers have developed a novel attack that steals user data by injecting malicious prompts in images processed by AI systems before delivering them to a large language model.

title: Farmers Insurance data breach impacts 1.1M people after Salesforce attack
summary: U.S. insurance giant Farmers Insurance has disclosed a data breach impacting 1.1 million customers, with BleepingComputer learning that the data was stolen in the widespread Salesforce attacks.

title: Auchan retailer data breach impacts hundreds of thousands of customers
summary: French retailer Auchan is informing that some sensitive data associated with loyalty accounts of several hundred thousand of its customers was exposed in a cyberattack.

title: Malicious Android apps with 19M installs removed from Google Play
summary: Seventy-seven malicious Android apps containing different types of malware were found on Google Play after being downloaded more than 19 million times.

title: Critical Docker Desktop flaw lets attackers hijack Windows hosts
summary: A critical vulnerability in Docker Desktop for Windows and macOS allows compromising the host by running a malicious container, even if the Enhanced Container Isolation (ECI) protection is active.

title: Defending against malware persistence techniques with Wazuh

title: New Android malware poses as antivirus from Russian intelligence agency
summary: A new Android malware posing as an antivirus tool software created by Russia's Federal Security Services agency (FSB) is being used to target executives of Russian businesses.

title: FTC warns tech giants not to bow to foreign pressure on encryption
summary: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) is warning major U.S. tech companies against yielding to foreign government demands that weaken data security, compromise encryption, or impose censorship on their platforms.

title: Murky Panda hackers exploit cloud trust to hack downstream customers

title: APT36 hackers abuse Linux .desktop files to install malware in new attacks
summary: The Pakistani APT36 cyberspies are using Linux .desktop files to load malware in new attacks against government and defense entities in India.

title: Fake Mac fixes trick users into installing new Shamos infostealer

title: Massive anti-cybercrime operation leads to over 1,200 arrests in Africa
summary: Law enforcement authorities in Africa have arrested over 1,200 suspects as part of 'Operation Serengeti 2.0,' an INTERPOL-led international crackdown targeting cross-border cybercriminal gangs.

title: DaVita says ransomware gang stole data of nearly 2.7 million people
summary: Kidney dialysis firm DaVita has confirmed that a ransomware gang that breached its network stole the personal and health information of nearly 2.7 million individuals.

title: Dev gets 4 years for creating kill switch on ex-employer's systems

title: Colt confirms customer data stolen as Warlock ransomware auctions files
summary: UK-based telecommunications company Colt Technology Services confirms that customer documentation was stolen as Warlock ransomware gang auctions files.

title: Europol confirms $50,000 Qilin ransomware reward is fake

title: Why Certified VMware Pros Are Driving the Future of IT
summary: From hybrid cloud to AI, IT complexity and security risks are accelerating. Certified VMware pros bring clarity and resilience that keep teams ahead. See why CIOs are making certification a workforce strategy with VMUG.

title: FBI warns of Russian hackers exploiting 7-year-old Cisco flaw
summary: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has warned that hackers linked to Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) are targeting critical infrastructure organizations in attacks exploiting a 7-year-old vulnerability in Cisco devices.

title: Scattered Spider hacker gets sentenced to 10 years in prison
summary: Noah Michael Urban, a key member of the Scattered Spider cybercrime collective, was sentenced to 10 years in prison on Wednesday after pleading guilty to charges of wire fraud and conspiracy in April.

title: Orange Belgium discloses data breach impacting 850,000 customers

title: AI website builder Lovable increasingly abused for malicious activity

title: Apple fixes new zero-day flaw exploited in targeted attacks
summary: Apple has released emergency updates to patch another zero-day vulnerability that was exploited in an "extremely sophisticated attack."

title: “Rapper Bot” malware seized, alleged developer identified and charged

title: Perplexity’s Comet AI browser tricked into buying fake items online
summary: A study looking into agentic AI browsers has found that these emerging tools are vulnerable to both new and old schemes that could make them interact with malicious pages and prompts.

title: Hackers steal Microsoft logins using legitimate ADFS redirects

title: Why email security needs its EDR moment to move beyond prevention

title: PyPI now blocks domain resurrection attacks used for hijacking accounts

title: Okta open-sources catalog of Auth0 rules for threat detection
summary: Okta has open-sourced ready-made Sigma-based queries for Auth0 customers to detect account takeovers, misconfigurations, and suspicious behavior in event logs.

title: Elastic rejects claims of a zero-day RCE flaw in Defend EDR
summary: Enterprise search and security company Elastic is rejecting reports of a zero-day vulnerability impacting its Defend endpoint detection and response (EDR) product.

title: Pharma firm Inotiv says ransomware attack impacted operations

title: NY Business Council discloses data breach affecting 47,000 people
summary: The Business Council of New York State (BCNYS) has revealed that attackers who breached its network in February stole the personal, financial, and health information of over 47,000 individuals.

title: Massive Allianz Life data breach impacts 1.1 million people
summary: Hackers have stolen the personal information of 1.1 million individuals in a Salesforce data theft attack, which impacted U.S. insurance giant Allianz Life in July.

title: XenoRAT malware campaign hits multiple embassies in South Korea
summary: A state-sponsored espionage campaign is targeting foreign embassies in South Korea to deploy XenoRAT malware from malicious GitHub repositories.

title: Nebraska man gets 1 year in prison for $3.5M cryptojacking scheme
summary: A Nebraska man was sentenced to one year in prison for defrauding cloud computing providers of over $3.5 million to mine cryptocurrency worth nearly $1 million.

title: UK sentences “serial hacker” of 3,000 sites to 20 months in prison
summary: A 26-year old in the UK who claimed to have hacked thousands of websites was sentenced to 20 months in prison after pleading guilty earlier this year.

title: Over 800 N-able servers left unpatched against critical flaws
summary: Over 800 N-able N-central servers remain unpatched against a pair of critical security vulnerabilities tagged as actively exploited last week.

title: HR giant Workday discloses data breach after Salesforce attack
summary: Human resources giant Workday has disclosed a data breach after attackers gained access to a third-party customer relationship management (CRM) platform in a recent social engineering attack.

title: U.S. seizes $2.8 million in crypto from Zeppelin ransomware operator
summary: The U.S. Department of Justice (DoJ) announced the seizure of over $2,800,000 in cryptocurrency from alleged ransomware operator Ianis Aleksandrovich Antropenko.

title: Researcher to release exploit for full auth bypass on FortiWeb
summary: A security researcher has released a partial proof of concept exploit for a vulnerability in the FortiWeb web application firewall that allows a remote attacker to bypass authentication.

title: Microsoft Teams to protect against malicious URLs, dangerous file types
summary: Microsoft recently revealed that it's enhancing protection against dangerous file types and malicious URLs in Teams chats and channels.

summary: UK-based telecommunications company Colt Technology Services is dealing with a cyberattack that has caused a multi-day outage of some of the company's operations, including hosting and porting services, Colt Online and Voice API platforms.

title: Cisco warns of max severity flaw in Firewall Management Center
summary: Cisco is warning about a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in the RADIUS subsystem of its Secure Firewall Management Center (FMC) software.

title: Plex warns users to patch security vulnerability immediately
summary: Plex has notified some of its users on Thursday to urgently update their media servers due to a recently patched security vulnerability.

title: US sanctions Grinex crypto-exchange, successor to Garantex
summary: The U.S. Department of the Treasury has announced sanctions against Grinex, the successor to Russian cryptocurrency exchange Garantex, which was previously sanctioned for helping ransomware gangs launder their money.

title: Over $300 million in cybercrime crypto seized in anti-fraud effort

title: Crypto24 ransomware hits large orgs with custom EDR evasion tool
summary: The Crypto24 ransomware group has been using custom utilities to evade security solutions on breached networks, exfiltrate data, and encrypt files.

title: Pro-Russian hackers blamed for water dam sabotage in Norway
summary: The Norwegian Police Security Service (PST) says that pro-Russian hackers took control of critical operation systems at a dam and opened outflow valves.

title: Booking.com phishing campaign uses sneaky 'ん' character to trick you
summary: Threat actors are leveraging a Unicode character to make phishing links appear like legitimate Booking.com links in a new campaign distributing malware. The attack makes use of the Japanese hiragana character, ん, which can, on some systems, appear as a forward slash and make a phishing URL appear realistic to a person at first.

summary: Ransomware and infostealers are winning on stealth, not encryption. Picus Blue Report 2025 reveals just 3% of data exfiltration attempts are stopped. Find and fix your biggest exposure gaps before they're exploited.

title: Canada’s House of Commons investigating data breach after cyberattack
summary: The House of Commons of Canada is currently investigating a data breach after a threat actor reportedly stole employee information in a cyberattack on Friday.

title: CISA warns of N-able N-central flaws exploited in zero-day attacks
summary: ​CISA warned on Wednesday that attackers are actively exploiting two security vulnerabilities in N‑able's N-central remote monitoring and management (RMM) platform.

title: Fortinet warns of FortiSIEM pre-auth RCE flaw with exploit in the wild
summary: Fortinet is warning about a remote unauthenticated command injection flaw in FortiSIEM that has in-the-wild exploit code, making it critical for admins to apply the latest security updates.

title: New downgrade attack can bypass FIDO auth in Microsoft Entra ID

title: Pennsylvania attorney general's email, site down after cyberattack
summary: The Office of the Pennsylvania Attorney General has announced that a recent cyberattack has taken down its systems, including landline phone lines and email accounts.

title: Microsoft removes PowerShell 2.0 from Windows 11, Windows Server
summary: Microsoft will remove PowerShell 2.0 from Windows starting in August, eight years after announcing its deprecation and keeping it around as an optional feature.

title: Hackers leak Allianz Life data stolen in Salesforce attacks
summary: Hackers have released stolen data belonging to US insurance giant Allianz Life, exposing 2.8 million records with sensitive information on business partners and customers in ongoing Salesforce data theft attacks.

title: Docker Hub still hosts dozens of Linux images with the XZ backdoor
summary: The XZ-Utils backdoor, first discovered in March 2024, is still present in at least 35 Linux images on Docker Hub, potentially putting users, organizations, and their data at risk.

title: Microsoft August 2025 Patch Tuesday fixes one zero-day, 107 flaws
summary: Today is Microsoft's August 2025 Patch Tuesday, which includes security updates for 107 flaws, including one publicly disclosed zero-day vulnerability in Windows Kerberos.

title: US govt seizes $1 million in crypto from BlackSuit ransomware gang
summary: The U.S. Department of Justice (DoJ) seized cryptocurrency and digital assets worth $1,091,453 at the time of confiscation, on January 9, 2024, from the BlackSuit ransomware gang.

title: Android's pKVM hypervisor earns SESIP Level 5 security certification
summary: Google announced that its protected Kernel-based Virtual Machine (pKVM) for Android has achieved SESIP Level 5 certification, the highest security assurance level for IoT and mobile platforms.

title: Curly COMrades cyberspies hit govt orgs with custom malware
summary: A new cyber-espionage threat group has been using a custom backdoor malware that provides persistent access through a seemingly inactive scheduled task.

title: Over 3,000 NetScaler devices left unpatched against CitrixBleed 2 bug
summary: Over 3,300 Citrix NetScaler devices remain unpatched against a critical vulnerability that allows attackers to bypass authentication by hijacking user sessions, nearly two months after patches were released.

title: 275M patient records breached—How to meet HIPAA password manager requirements

title: Manpower discloses data breach affecting nearly 145,000 people
summary: Manpower, one of the world's largest staffing companies, is notifying nearly 145,000 individuals that their information was stolen by attackers who breached the company's systems in December 2024.

title: Saint Paul cyberattack linked to Interlock ransomware gang
summary: The mayor of Saint Paul, Minnesota's capital city, has confirmed that the Interlock ransomware gang is responsible for a cyberattack that disrupted many of the city's systems and services in July.

title: North Korean Kimsuky hackers exposed in alleged data breach
summary: The North Korean state-sponsored hackers known as Kimsuky has reportedly suffered a data breach after two hackers, who describe themselves as the opposite of Kimsuky's values, stole the group's data and leaked it publicly online.

title: Netherlands: Citrix Netscaler flaw CVE-2025-6543 exploited to breach orgs
summary: The Netherlands' National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) is warning that a critical Citrix NetScaler vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-6543 was exploited to breach "critical organizations" in the country.

title: Details emerge on WinRAR zero-day attacks that infected PCs with malware
summary: Researchers have released a report detailing how a recent WinRAR path traversal vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-8088 was exploited in zero-day attacks by the Russian 'RomCom' hacking group to drop different malware payloads.

title: The Rise of Native Phishing: Microsoft 365 Apps Abused in Attacks
summary: Native phishing turns trusted tools into attack delivery systems. Varonis shows how attackers weaponize Microsoft 365 apps, like OneNote & OneDrive, to send convincing internal lures and how to spot them before they spread.

title: MuddyWater’s DarkBit ransomware cracked for free data recovery
summary: Cybersecurity firm Profero cracked the encryption of the DarkBit ransomware gang's encryptors, allowing them to recover a victim's files for free without paying a ransom.

title: 'Chairmen' of $100 million scam operation extradited to US
summary: The U.S. Department of Justice charged four Ghanaian nationals for their roles in a massive fraud ring linked to the theft of over $100 million in romance scams and business email compromise attacks.

title: Over 29,000 Exchange servers unpatched against high-severity flaw
summary: Over 29,000 Exchange servers exposed online remain unpatched against a high-severity vulnerability that can let attackers move laterally in Microsoft cloud environments, potentially leading to complete domain compromise.

title: Connex Credit Union data breach impacts 172,000 members
summary: Connex, one of Connecticut's largest credit unions, warned tens of thousands of members that unknown attackers had stolen their personal and financial information after breaching its systems in early June.

title: Google Calendar invites let researchers hijack Gemini to leak user data
summary: Google fixed a bug that allowed maliciously crafted Google Calendar invites to remotely take over Gemini agents running on the target's device and leak sensitive user data.

title: Google confirms data breach exposed potential Google Ads customers' info
summary: Google has confirmed that a recently disclosed data breach of one of its Salesforce CRM instances involved the information of potential Google Ads customers.

title: 60 malicious Ruby gems downloaded 275,000 times steal credentials
summary: Sixty malicious Ruby gems containing credential-stealing code have been downloaded over 275,000 times since March 2023, targeting developer accounts.

title: WinRAR zero-day exploited to plant malware on archive extraction
summary: A recently fixed WinRAR vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-8088 was exploited as a zero-day in phishing attacks to install the RomCom malware.

title: FTC: Older adults lost record $700 million to scammers in 2024
summary: Americans aged 60 and older lost a staggering $700 million to online scams in 2024, marking a sharp rise in fraud targeting seniors, according to the Federal Trade Commission.

title: U.S. Judiciary confirms breach of court electronic records service
summary: The U.S. Federal Judiciary confirms that it suffered a cyberattack on its electronic case management systems hosting confidential court documents and is strengthening cybersecurity measures.

title: Microsoft 365 apps to soon block file access via FPRPC by default
summary: Microsoft has announced that the Microsoft 365 apps for Windows will start blocking access to files via the insecure FPRPC legacy authentication protocol by default starting late August.

title: Columbia University data breach impacts nearly 870,000 individuals
summary: ​An unknown threat actor has stolen the sensitive personal, financial, and health information of nearly 870,000 Columbia University current and former students and employees after breaching the university's network in May.

title: Royal and BlackSuit ransomware gangs hit over 450 US companies
summary: The U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) says the cybercrime gang behind the Royal and BlackSuit ransomware operations had breached hundreds of U.S. companies before their infrastructure was dismantled last month.

title: Fake WhatsApp developer libraries hide destructive data-wiping code

title: CISA orders fed agencies to patch new Exchange flaw by Monday

title: New EDR killer tool used by eight different ransomware groups

title: Bouygues Telecom confirms data breach impacting 6.4 million customers
summary: Bouygues Telecom warns it suffered a data breach after the personal information of 6.4 million customers was exposed in a cyberattack.

title: SonicWall finds no SSLVPN zero-day, links ransomware attacks to 2024 flaw
summary: SonicWall says that recent Akira ransomware attacks exploiting Gen 7 firewalls with SSLVPN enabled are exploiting an older vulnerability rather than a zero-day flaw.

title: Wave of 150 crypto-draining extensions hits Firefox add-on store

title: Google sues to disrupt BadBox 2.0 botnet infecting 10 million devices

title: Hacker steals $27 million in BigONE exchange crypto breach

title: Co-op confirms data of 6.5 million members stolen in cyberattack

title: Louis Vuitton says regional data breaches tied to same cyberattack

title: Cloudflare says 1.1.1.1 outage not caused by attack or BGP hijack

title: Europol disrupts pro-Russian NoName057(16) DDoS hacktivist group

title: Google fixes actively exploited sandbox escape zero day in Chrome

title: Abacus dark web drug market goes offline in suspected exit scam

title: North Korean XORIndex malware hidden in 67 malicious npm packages

title: Police disrupt “Diskstation” ransomware gang attacking NAS devices

title: Premium WordPress 'Motors' theme vulnerable to admin takeover attacks
summary: A critical privilege escalation vulnerability has been discovered in the premium WordPress theme Motors, which allows unauthenticated attackers to hijack administrator accounts and take complete control of websites.

title: VanHelsing ransomware builder leaked on hacking forum
summary: The VanHelsing ransomware-as-a-service operation published the source code for its affiliate panel, data leak blog, and Windows encryptor builder after an old developer tried to sell it on the RAMP cybercrime forum.

title: SK Telecom says malware breach lasted 3 years, impacted 27 million numbers
summary: SK Telecom says that a recently disclosed cybersecurity incident in April, first occurred all the way back in 2022, ultimately exposing the USIM data of 27 million subscribers.

title: Hazy Hawk gang exploits DNS misconfigs to hijack trusted domains
summary: A threat actor named 'Hazy Hawk' has been using DNS CNAME hijacking to hijack abandoned cloud endpoints of domains belonging to trusted organizations and incorporate them in large-scale scam delivery and traffic distribution systems (TDS).

title: Trojanized RVTools push Bumblebee malware in SEO poisoning campaign
summary: The official website for the RVTools VMware management tool was taken offline in what appears to be a supply chain attack that distributed a trojanized installer to drop the Bumblebee malware loader on users' machines.

title: Service desks are under attack: What can you do about it?
summary: Service desks are on the front lines of defense—and attackers know it. Attackers are using social engineering attacks to trick agents into changing passwords, disabling MFA, and granting access. Learn more from Specops Software on how to secure your service desk.

title: Fake KeePass password manager leads to ESXi ransomware attack
summary: Threat actors have been distributing trojanized versions of the KeePass password manager for at least eight months to install Cobalt Strike beacons, steal credentials, and ultimately, deploy ransomware on the breached network.

title: O2 UK patches bug leaking mobile user location from call metadata
summary: A flaw in O2 UK's implementation of VoLTE and WiFi Calling technologies could allow anyone to expose the general location of a person and other identifiers by calling the target.

title: Arla Foods confirms cyberattack disrupts production, causes delays
summary: Arla Foods has confirmed to BleepingComputer that it was targeted by a cyberattack that has disrupted its production operations.

title: UK Legal Aid Agency confirms applicant data stolen in data breach
summary: The United Kingdom's Legal Aid Agency (LAA) has confirmed that a recent cyberattack is more serious than first believed, with hackers stealing a large trove of sensitive applicant data in a data breach.

title: Mozilla fixes Firefox zero-days exploited at hacking contest
summary: Mozilla released emergency security updates to address two Firefox zero-day vulnerabilities demonstrated in the recent Pwn2Own Berlin 2025 hacking competition.

title: Hackers earn $1,078,750 for 28 zero-days at Pwn2Own Berlin
summary: The Pwn2Own Berlin 2025 hacking competition has concluded, with security researchers earning $1,078,750 after exploiting 29 zero-day vulnerabilities and encountering some bug collisions.

title: New 'Defendnot' tool tricks Windows into disabling Microsoft Defender
summary: A new tool called 'Defendnot' can disable Microsoft Defender on Windows devices by registering a fake antivirus product, even when no real AV is installed.

title: Hackers exploit VMware ESXi, Microsoft SharePoint zero-days at Pwn2Own
summary: During the second day of Pwn2Own Berlin 2025, competitors earned $435,000 after exploiting zero-day bugs in multiple products, including Microsoft SharePoint, VMware ESXi, Oracle VirtualBox, Red Hat Enterprise Linux, and Mozilla Firefox.

title: Printer maker Procolored offered malware-laced drivers for months
summary: For at least half a year, the official software supplied with Procolored printers included malware in the form of a remote access trojan and a cryptocurrency stealer.

title: Ransomware gangs increasingly use Skitnet post-exploitation malware
summary: Ransomware gang members increasingly use a new malware called Skitnet ("Bossnet") to perform stealthy post-exploitation activities on breached networks.

title: US charges 12 more suspects linked to $230 million crypto theft
summary: Twelve more suspects were charged in a RICO conspiracy for their alleged involvement in the theft of over $230 million in cryptocurrency and laundering the funds using crypto exchanges and mixing services.

title: CISA tags recently patched Chrome bug as actively exploited
summary: On Thursday, CISA warned U.S. federal agencies to secure their systems against ongoing attacks exploiting a high-severity vulnerability in the Chrome web browser.

title: Government webmail hacked via XSS bugs in global spy campaign
summary: Hackers are running a worldwide cyberespionage campaign dubbed 'RoundPress,' leveraging zero-day and n-day flaws in webmail servers to steal email from high-value government organizations.

title: FBI: US officials targeted in voice deepfake attacks since April
summary: The FBI warned that cybercriminals using AI-generated audio deepfakes to target U.S. officials in voice phishing attacks that started in April.

title: Nova Scotia Power confirms hackers stole customer data in cyberattack
summary: Nova Scotia Power confirms it suffered a data breach after threat actors stole sensitive customer data in a cybersecurity incident discovered last month.

title: Windows 11 and Red Hat Linux hacked on first day of Pwn2Own
summary: On the first day of Pwn2Own Berlin 2025, security researchers were awarded $260,000 after successfully demonstrating zero-day exploits for Windows 11, Red Hat Linux, Docker Desktop, and Oracle VirtualBox.

title: New Tor Oniux tool anonymizes any Linux app's network traffic
summary: Tor has announced Oniux, a new command-line tool for routing any Linux application securely through the Tor network for anonymized network connections.

title: Malicious NPM package uses Unicode steganography to evade detection
summary: A malicious package in the Node Package Manager index uses invisible Unicode characters to hide malicious code and Google Calendar links to host the URL for the command-and-control location.

title: Coinbase data breach exposes customer info and government IDs
summary: Coinbase, a cryptocurrency exchange with over 100 million customers, has disclosed that cybercriminals working with rogue support agents stole customer data and demanded a $20 million ransom not to publish the stolen information.

title: Google fixes high severity Chrome flaw with public exploit
summary: Google has released emergency security updates to patch a high-severity Chrome vulnerability that has a public exploit and can let attackers hijack accounts.

title: Google Chrome to block admin-level browser launches for better security
summary: Google is rolling out a change to Chromium that "de-elevates" Google Chrome so it does not run as an administrator to increase security in Windows.

title: Hackers behind UK retail attacks now targeting US companies
summary: Google warned today that hackers using Scattered Spider tactics against retail chains in the United Kingdom have also started targeting retailers in the United States.

title: Ransomware gangs join ongoing SAP NetWeaver attacks
summary: Ransomware gangs have joined ongoing SAP NetWeaver attacks, exploiting a maximum-severity vulnerability that allows threat actors to gain remote code execution on vulnerable servers.

title: Australian Human Rights Commission leaks docs to search engines
summary: The Australian Human Rights Commission (AHRC) disclosed a data breach incident where private documents leaked online and were indexed by major search engines.

title: Steel giant Nucor Corporation facing disruptions after cyberattack
summary: A cybersecurity incident on Nucor Corporation's systems forced the company to take offline parts of its networks and implement containment measures.

title: Focused Phishing: Attack Targets Victims With Trusted Sites and Live Validation
summary: New phishing tactics are abusing trusted domains, real CAPTCHAs, and server-side email validation to selectively target victims with customized fake login pages. Keep Aware's latest research breaks down the full attack chain and how these zero-day phish operate.

title: Fashion giant Dior discloses cyberattack, warns of data breach
summary: House of Dior, the French luxury fashion brand commonly referred to as Dior, has disclosed a cybersecurity incident that has exposed customer information.

title: Kosovo extradites BlackDB admin to face US cybercrime charges
summary: A Kosovo national has been extradited to the United States to face charges of running an online cybercrime marketplace active since 2018.

title: SAP patches second zero-day flaw exploited in recent attacks
summary: SAP has released patches to address a second vulnerability exploited in recent attacks targeting SAP NetWeaver servers as a zero-day.
