title: Auto parts giant LKQ says cyberattack disrupted Canadian business unit
summary: Automobile parts giant LKQ Corporation disclosed that one of its business units in Canada was hacked, allowing threat actors to steal data from the company.

title: Citrix shares mitigations for ongoing Netscaler password spray attacks
summary: Citrix Netscaler is the latest target in widespread password spray attacks targeting edge networking devices and cloud platforms this year to breach corporate networks.

title: CISA confirms critical Cleo bug exploitation in ransomware attacks
summary: CISA confirmed today that a critical remote code execution bug in Cleo Harmony, VLTrader, and LexiCom file transfer software is being exploited in ransomware attacks.

title: FTC warns of online task job scams hooking victims like gambling
summary: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) warns about a significant rise in gambling-like online job scams, known as "task scams," that draw people into earning cash through repetitive tasks, with the promises of earning more if they deposit their own money.

title: CISA warns water facilities to secure HMI systems exposed online
summary: CISA and the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) warned water facilities today to secure Internet-exposed Human Machine Interfaces (HMIs) from cyberattacks.

title: Russia blocks Viber in latest attempt to censor communications
summary: Russian telecommunications watchdog Roskomnadzor has blocked the Viber encrypted messaging app, used by hundreds of millions worldwide, for violating the country's legislation.

title: Russian cyberspies target Android users with new spyware
summary: Russian cyberspies Gamaredon has been discovered using two Android spyware families named 'BoneSpy' and 'PlainGnome' to spy on and steal data from mobile devices.

title: Germany blocks BadBox malware loaded on 30,000 Android devices
summary: Germany's Federal Office for Information Security (BSI) has disrupted the BadBox malware operation pre-loaded in over 30,000 Android IoT devices sold in the country.

title: New stealthy Pumakit Linux rootkit malware spotted in the wild
summary: A new Linux rootkit malware called Pumakit has been discovered that uses stealth and advanced privilege escalation techniques to hide its presence on systems.

title: Police shuts down Rydox cybercrime market, arrests 3 admins
summary: International law enforcement operation seizes the Rydox cybercrime marketplace and arrests three administrators.

title: New IOCONTROL malware used in critical infrastructure attacks
summary: Iranian threat actors are utilizing a new malware named IOCONTROL to compromise Internet of Things (IoT) devices and OT/SCADA systems used by critical infrastructure in Israel and the United States.

title: US offers $5 million for info on North Korean IT worker farms
summary: ​The U.S. State Department is offering a reward of up to $5 million for information that could help disrupt the activities of North Korean front companies and employees who generated over $88 million via illegal remote IT work schemes in six years.

title: Cleo patches critical zero-day exploited in data theft attacks
summary: Cleo has released security updates for a zero-day flaw in its LexiCom, VLTransfer, and Harmony software, currently exploited in data theft attacks.

title: Spain busts voice phishing ring for defrauding 10,000 bank customers
summary: The Spanish police, working with colleagues in Peru, conducted a simultaneous crackdown on a large-scale voice phishing (vishing) scam ring in the two countries, arresting 83 individuals.

title: Bitcoin ATM firm Byte Federal hacked via GitLab flaw, 58K users exposed
summary: US Bitcoin ATM operator Byte Federal has disclosed a data breach that exposed the data of 58,000 customers after its systems were breached using a GitLab vulnerability.

title: Hunk Companion WordPress plugin exploited to install vulnerable plugins
summary: Hackers are exploiting a critical vulnerability in the "Hunk Companion" plugin to install and activate other plugins with exploitable flaws directly from the WordPress.org repository.

title: Cynet Delivers 100% Protection and 100% Detection Visibility in the 2024 MITRE ATT&CK Evaluation
summary: The 2024 MITRE ATT&CK Evaluation results are now available with Cynet achieving 100% Visibility and 100% Protection in the 2024 evaluation. Learn more from Cynet about what these results mean.

title: New EagleMsgSpy Android spyware used by Chinese police, researchers say
summary: A previously undocumented Android spyware called 'EagleMsgSpy' has been discovered and is believed to be used by law enforcement agencies in China to monitor mobile devices.

title: Russian cyber spies hide behind other hackers to target Ukraine
summary: Russian cyber-espionage group Turla, aka "Secret Blizzard," is utilizing other threat actors' infrastructure to target Ukrainian military devices connected via Starlink.

title: Operation PowerOFF shuts down 27 DDoS-for-hire platforms
summary: Law enforcement agencies from 15 countries have taken 27 DDoS-for-hire services offline, also known as "booters" or "stressers," arrested three administrators, and identified 300 customers of the platforms.

title: Lynx ransomware behind Electrica energy supplier cyberattack
summary: ​The Romanian National Cybersecurity Directorate (DNSC) says the Lynx ransomware gang breached Electrica Group, one of the largest electricity suppliers in the country.

title: Krispy Kreme cyberattack impacts online orders and operations
summary: US doughnut chain Krispy Kreme suffered a cyberattack in November that impacted portions of its business operations, including placing online orders.

title: Wyden proposes bill to secure US telecoms after Salt Typhoon hacks
summary: U.S. Senator Ron Wyden of Oregon announced a new bill to secure the networks of American telecommunications companies breached by Salt Typhoon Chinese state hackers earlier this year.

title: WPForms bug allows Stripe refunds on millions of WordPress sites
summary: A vulnerability in WPForms, a WordPress plugin used in over 6 million websites, could allow subscriber-level users to issue arbitrary Stripe refunds or cancel subscriptions.

title: Ivanti warns of maximum severity CSA auth bypass vulnerability
summary: Ivanti warned customers on Tuesday about a new maximum-severity authentication bypass vulnerability in its Cloud Services Appliance (CSA) solution.

title: Microsoft December 2024 Patch Tuesday fixes 1 exploited zero-day, 71 flaws
summary: Today is Microsoft's December 2024 Patch Tuesday, which includes security updates for 71 flaws, including one actively exploited zero-day vulnerability.

title: US sanctions Chinese firm for hacking firewalls in ransomware attacks
summary: The U.S. Treasury Department has sanctioned Chinese cybersecurity company Sichuan Silence and one of its employees for their involvement in a series of Ragnarok ransomware attacks targeting U.S. critical infrastructure companies and many other victims worldwide in April 2020.

title: New Cleo zero-day RCE flaw exploited in data theft attacks
summary: Hackers are actively exploiting a zero-day vulnerability in Cleo managed file transfer software to breach corporate networks and conduct data theft attacks.

title: Inside the incident: Uncovering an advanced phishing attack
summary: Recently, Varonis investigated a phishing campaign in which a malicious email enabled a threat actor to access the organization. This blog post will reveal the tactics used to avoid detection and share what was discovered during the investigation.

title: Chinese hackers use Visual Studio Code tunnels for remote access
summary: Chinese hackers targeting large IT service providers in Southern Europe were seen abusing Visual Studio Code (VSCode) tunnels to maintain persistent access to compromised systems.

title: Ransomware attack hits leading heart surgery device maker
summary: ​Artivion, a leading manufacturer of heart surgery medical devices, has disclosed a November 21 ransomware attack that disrupted its operations and forced it to take some systems offline.

title: OpenWrt Sysupgrade flaw let hackers push malicious firmware images
summary: A flaw in OpenWrt's Attended Sysupgrade feature used to build custom, on-demand firmware images could have allowed for the distribution of malicious firmware packages.

title: Radiant links $50 million crypto heist to North Korean hackers
summary: Radiant Capital now says that North Korean threat actors are behind the $50 million cryptocurrency heist that occurred after hackers breached its systems in an October 16 cyberattack.

title: Cybercrime gang arrested after turning Airbnbs into fraud centers
summary: Eight members of an international cybercrime network that stole millions of Euros from victims and set up Airbnb fraud centers were arrested in Belgium and the Netherlands.

title: Romanian energy supplier Electrica hit by ransomware attack
summary: Electrica Group, a key player in the Romanian electricity distribution and supply market, is investigating a ransomware attack that was still "in progress" earlier today.

title: QR codes bypass browser isolation for malicious C2 communication
summary: Mandiant has identified a novel method to bypass contemporary browser isolation technology and achieve command-and-control C2 operations.

title: Anna Jaques Hospital ransomware breach exposed data of 300K patients
summary: Anna Jaques Hospital has confirmed on its website that a ransomware attack it suffered almost precisely a year ago, on December 25, 2023, has exposed sensitive health data for over 316,000 patients.

title: Ultralytics AI model hijacked to infect thousands with cryptominer
summary: The popular Ultralytics YOLO11 AI model was compromised in a supply chain attack to deploy cryptominers on devices running versions 8.3.41 and 8.3.42 from the Python Package Index (PyPI)

title: Blue Yonder SaaS giant breached by Termite ransomware gang
summary: ​The Termite ransomware gang has officially claimed responsibility for the November breach of software as a service (SaaS) provider Blue Yonder.

title: New Windows zero-day exposes NTLM credentials, gets unofficial patch
summary: A new zero-day vulnerability has been discovered that allows attackers to capture NTLM credentials by simply tricking the target into viewing a malicious file in Windows Explorer.

title: Crypto-stealing malware posing as a meeting app targets Web3 pros
summary: Cybercriminals are targeting people working in Web3 with fake business meetings using a fraudulent video conferencing platform that infects Windows and Macs with crypto-stealing malware.

title: Nebraska man pleads guilty to $3.5 million cryptojacking scheme
summary: ​A Nebraska man pleaded guilty on Thursday to operating a large-scale cryptojacking operation after being arrested and charged in April.

title: Romania's election systems targeted in over 85,000 cyberattacks
summary: A declassified report from Romania's Intelligence Service says that the country's election infrastructure was targeted by more than 85,000 cyberattacks.

title: U.S. org suffered four month intrusion by Chinese hackers
summary: A large U.S. organization with significant presence in China has been reportedly breached by China-based threat actors who persisted on its networks from April to August 2024.

title: US arrests Scattered Spider suspect linked to telecom hacks
summary: ​U.S. authorities have arrested a 19-year-old teenager linked to the notorious Scattered Spider cybercrime gang who is now charged with breaching a U.S. financial institution and two unnamed telecommunications firms.

title: Police shuts down Manson cybercrime market, arrests key suspects
summary: German law enforcement has seized over 50 servers that hosted the Manson Market cybercrime marketplace and fake online shops used in phishing operations.

title: New Android spyware found on phone seized by Russian FSB
summary: After a Russian programmer was detained by Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) for fifteen days and his phone confiscated, it was discovered that a new spyware was secretly installed on his device upon its return.

title: Latrodectus malware and how to defend against it with Wazuh
summary: Latrodectus is a versatile malware family that infiltrate systems, steal sensitive data, and evades detection. Learn more from Wazuh about Latrodectus malware and how to defend against it using the open-source XDR.

title: Mitel MiCollab zero-day flaw gets proof-of-concept exploit
summary: Researchers have uncovered an arbitrary file read zero-day in the Mitel MiCollab collaboration platform, allowing attackers to access files on a server's filesystem.

title: White House: Salt Typhoon hacked telcos in dozens of countries
summary: ​Chinese state hackers, known as Salt Typhoon, have breached telecommunications companies in dozens of countries, President Biden's deputy national security adviser Anne Neuberger said today.

title: FBI shares tips on how to tackle AI-powered fraud schemes
summary: The FBI warns that scammers are increasingly using artificial intelligence to improve the quality and effectiveness of their online fraud schemes, ranging from romance and investment scams to job hiring schemes.

title: UK disrupts Russian money laundering networks used by ransomware
summary: ​A law enforcement operation led by the United Kingdom's National Crime Agency (NCA) has disrupted two Russian money laundering networks working with criminals worldwide, including ransomware gangs.

title: BT unit took servers offline after Black Basta ransomware breach
summary: Multinational telecommunications giant BT Group (formerly British Telecom) has confirmed that its BT Conferencing business division shut down some of its servers following a Black Basta ransomware breach.

title: New DroidBot Android malware targets 77 banking, crypto apps
summary: A new Android banking malware named 'DroidBot' attempts to steal credentials for over 77 cryptocurrency exchanges and banking apps in the UK, Italy, France, Spain, and Portugal.

title: Solana Web3.js library backdoored to steal secret, private keys
summary: The legitimate Solana JavaScript SDK was temporarily compromised yesterday in a supply chain attack, with the library backdoored with malicious code to steal cryptocurrency private keys and drain wallets.

title: Russian hackers hijack Pakistani hackers' servers for their own attacks
summary: The notorious Russian cyber-espionage group Turla is hacking other hackers, hijacking the Pakistani threat actor Storm-0156's infrastructure to launch their own covert attacks on already compromised networks.

title: Japan warns of IO-Data zero-day router flaws exploited in attacks
summary: Japan's CERT is warning that hackers are exploiting zero-day vulnerabilities in I-O Data router devices to modify device settings, execute commands, or even turn off the firewall.

title: Six password takeaways from the updated NIST cybersecurity framework
summary: Updated NIST guidelines reject outdated password security practices in favor of more effective protections. Learn from Specops Software about 6 takeaways from NIST's new guidance that help create strong password policies.

title: Vodka maker Stoli files for bankruptcy in US after ransomware attack
summary: Stoli Group's U.S. companies have filed for bankruptcy following an August ransomware attack and Russian authorities seizing the company's remaining distilleries in the country.

title: Cloudflare’s developer domains increasingly abused by threat actors
summary: Cloudflare's 'pages.dev' and 'workers.dev' domains, used for deploying web pages and facilitating serverless computing, are being increasingly abused by cybercriminals for phishing and other malicious activities.

title: US shares tips to block hackers behind recent telecom breaches
summary: ​CISA released guidance today to help network defenders harden their systems against attacks coordinated by the Salt Typhoon Chinese threat group that breached multiple major global telecommunications providers earlier this year.

title: Exploit released for critical WhatsUp Gold RCE flaw, patch now
summary: A proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for a critical-severity remote code execution flaw in Progress WhatsUp Gold has been published, making it critical to install the latest security updates as soon as possible.

title: Veeam warns of critical RCE bug in Service Provider Console
summary: ​Veeam released security updates today to address two Service Provider Console (VSPC) vulnerabilities, including a critical remote code execution (RCE) discovered during internal testing.

title: Police seizes largest German online crime marketplace, arrests admin
summary: Germany has taken down the largest online cybercrime marketplace in the country, named "Crimenetwork," and arrested its administrator for facilitating the sale of drugs, stolen data, and illegal services.

title: FTC bans data brokers from selling Americans’ sensitive location data
summary: Today, the FTC banned data brokers Mobilewalla and Gravy Analytics from harvesting and selling Americans' location tracking data linked to sensitive locations, like churches, healthcare facilities, military installations, and schools.

title: Police seize Matrix encrypted chat service after spying on criminals
summary: An international law enforcement operation codenamed 'Operation Passionflower' has shut down MATRIX, an encrypted messaging platform used by cybercriminals to coordinate illegal activities while evading police.

title: Korea arrests CEO for adding DDoS feature to satellite receivers
summary: South Korean police have arrested a CEO and five employees for manufacturing over 240,000 satellite receivers pre-loaded or later updated to include DDoS attack functionality at a purchaser's request.

title: Russia sentences Hydra dark web market leader to life in prison
summary: Russian authorities have sentenced the leader of the criminal group behind the now-closed dark web platform Hydra Market to life in prison.

title: BootKitty UEFI malware exploits LogoFAIL to infect Linux systems
summary: The recently uncovered 'Bootkitty' UEFI bootkit, the first malware of its kind targeting Linux systems, exploits CVE-2023-40238, aka 'LogoFAIL,' to infect computers running on a vulnerable UEFI firmware.

title: Novel phishing campaign uses corrupted Word documents to evade security
summary: A novel phishing attack abuses Microsoft's Word file recovery feature by sending corrupted Word documents as email attachments, allowing them to bypass security software due to their damaged state but still be recoverable by the application.

title: SpyLoan Android malware on Google Play installed 8 million times
summary: A new set of 15 SpyLoan Android malware apps with over 8 million installs was discovered on Google Play, targeting primarily users from South America, Southeast Asia, and Africa.

title: New Rockstar 2FA phishing service targets Microsoft 365 accounts
summary: A new phishing-as-a-service (PhaaS) platform named 'Rockstar 2FA' has emerged, facilitating large-scale adversary-in-the-middle (AiTM) attacks to steal Microsoft 365 credentials.

title: Russia arrests cybercriminal Wazawaka for ties with ransomware gangs
summary: Russian law enforcement has arrested and indicted notorious ransomware affiliate Mikhail Pavlovich Matveev (also known as Wazawaka, Uhodiransomwar, m1x, and Boriselcin) for developing malware and his involvement in several hacking groups.

title: Bologna FC confirms data breach after RansomHub ransomware attack
summary: Bologna Football Club 1909 has confirmed it suffered a ransomware attack after its stolen data was leaked online by the RansomHub extortion group.

title: New Windows Server 2012 zero-day gets free, unofficial patches
summary: Free unofficial security patches have been released through the 0patch platform to address a zero-day vulnerability introduced over two years ago in the Windows Mark of the Web (MotW) security mechanism.

title: Tor needs 200 new WebTunnel bridges to fight censorship
summary: The Tor Project has put out an urgent call to the privacy community asking volunteers to help deploy 200 new WebTunnel bridges by the end of the year to fight government censorship.

title: UK hospital network postpones procedures after cyberattack
summary: Major UK healthcare provider Wirral University Teaching Hospital (WUTH), part of the NHS Foundation Trust, has suffered a cyberattack that caused a systems outage leading to postponing appointments and scheduled procedures.

title: Microsoft re-releases Exchange updates after fixing mail delivery
summary: ​Microsoft has re-released the November 2024 security updates for Exchange Server after pulling them earlier this month due to email delivery issues on servers using custom mail flow rules.

title: Hackers abuse popular Godot game engine to infect thousands of PCs
summary: ​Hackers have used new GodLoader malware exploiting the capabilities of the widely used Godot game engine to evade detection and infect over 17,000 systems in just three months.

title: Hackers exploit ProjectSend flaw to backdoor exposed servers
summary: Threat actors are using public exploits for a critical authentication bypass flaw in ProjectSend to upload webshells and gain remote access to servers.

title: Zello asks users to reset passwords after security incident
summary: Zello is warning customers to reset their passwords if their account was created before November 2nd in what appears to be another security breach.

title: Researchers discover first UEFI bootkit malware for Linux
summary: The first UEFI bootkit specifically targeting Linux systems has been discovered, marking a shift in stealthy and hard-to-remove bootkit threats that previously focused on Windows.

title: Chinese hackers breached T-Mobile's routers to scope out network
summary: T-Mobile says the Chinese "Salt Typhoon" hackers who recently compromised its systems as part of a series of telecom breaches first hacked into some of its routers to explore ways to navigate laterally through the network.

title: Cloudflare says it lost 55% of logs pushed to customers for 3.5 hours
summary: Internet security giant Cloudflare announced that it lost 55% of all logs pushed to customers over a 3.5-hour period due to a bug in the log collection service on November 14, 2024.

title: The Black Friday 2024 Cybersecurity, IT, VPN, & Antivirus Deals
summary: Black Friday 2024 is almost here, and great deals are already live in computer security, software, online courses, system admin services, antivirus, and VPN software. These promotions offer deep discounts from various companies and are only available for a limited time.

title: New NachoVPN attack uses rogue VPN servers to install malicious updates
summary: A set of vulnerabilities dubbed "NachoVPN" allows rogue VPN servers to install malicious updates when unpatched Palo Alto and SonicWall SSL-VPN clients connect to them.

title: NordVPN Black Friday Deal: Save up to 74% on yearly subscriptions
summary: Want the best VPN with a 74% discount? The NordVPN Black Friday deal is live and runs until December 10. This is the perfect chance to lock in a 2-year plan for the low cost of $2.99 per month, with an extra 3 months for free.

title: Over 1,000 arrested in massive ‘Serengeti’ anti-cybercrime operation
summary: Law enforcement agencies in Africa arrested as part of 'Operation Serengeti' more than a thousand individuals suspected of being involved in major cybercriminal activities that caused close to $193 million in financial losses all over the world.

title: Get 50% off Malwarebytes during Black Friday 2024
summary: Malwarebytes' Black Friday 2024 deals are now live, offering a 50% discount for one and two-year subscriptions to personal, family, and business subscriptions to its standalone anti-malware software, VPN, and Personal Data Remover services.

title: Why Cybersecurity Leaders Trust the MITRE ATT&CK Evaluations
summary: The "MITRE Engenuity ATT&CK Evaluations: Enterprise" stand out as an essential resource for cybersecurity decision makers. Learn more from Cynet on what to expect in the upcoming 2024 MITRE ATT&CK Evaluation results.

title: Hackers exploit critical bug in Array Networks SSL VPN products
summary: America's cyber defense agency has received evidence of hackers actively exploiting a remote code execution vulnerability in SSL VPN products Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS.

title: Firefox and Windows zero-days exploited by Russian RomCom hackers
summary: ​Russian-based RomCom cybercrime group chained two zero-day vulnerabilities in recent attacks targeting Firefox and Tor Browser users across Europe and North America.

title: QNAP addresses critical flaws across NAS, router software
summary: QNAP has released security bulletins over the weekend, which address multiple vulnerabilities, including three critical severity flaws that users should address as soon as possible.

title: Blue Yonder ransomware attack disrupts grocery store supply chain
summary: Supply chain management firm Blue Yonder is warning that a ransomware attack caused significant disruption to its services, with the outages impacting grocery store chains in the UK.

title: DOJ: Man hacked networks to pitch cybersecurity services
summary: A Kansas City man has been indicted for allegedly hacking into computer networks and using this access to promote his cybersecurity services.

title: Salt Typhoon hackers backdoor telcos with new GhostSpider malware
summary: The Chinese state-sponsored hacking group Salt Typhoon has been observed utilizing a new "GhostSpider" backdoor in attacks against telecommunication service providers.

title: Meta removes over 2 million accounts pushing pig butchering scams
summary: Meta announced that it has taken down 2 million accounts across its platforms since the beginning of the year that are linked to pig butchering and other scams.

title: Bangkok busts SMS Blaster sending 1 million scam texts from a van
summary: The Thai police, working together with Thailand's largest telecommunications service provider, Advanced Info Service (AIS), located and busted the Chinese operators of an SMS blaster device that spammed fraudulent messages across Bangkok.

title: Microsoft testing Windows 11 support for third-party passkeys
summary: ​Microsoft is now testing WebAuthn API updates that add support for using third-party passkey providers for Windows 11 passwordless authentication.

title: Hackers abuse Avast anti-rootkit driver to disable defenses
summary: A new malicious campaign is using a legitimate but old and vulnerable Avast Anti-Rootkit driver to evade detection and take control of the target system by disabling security components.

title: Hackers breach US firm over Wi-Fi from Russia in 'Nearest Neighbor Attack'
summary: Russian state hackers APT28 (Fancy Bear/Forest Blizzard/Sofacy) breached a U.S. company through its enterprise WiFi network while being thousands of miles away, by leveraging a novel technique called "nearest neighbor attack."

title: Microsoft rolls out Recall to Windows Insiders with Copilot+ PCs
summary: ​Microsoft announced today that its controversial AI-powered Recall feature is finally rolling out to Windows Insiders in the Dev Channel using Snapdragon-powered Copilot+ PCs.

title: Chinese hackers target Linux with new WolfsBane malware
summary: A new Linux backdoor called 'WolfsBane' has been discovered, believed to be a port of Windows malware used by the Chinese 'Gelsemium' hacking group.

title: Over 2,000 Palo Alto firewalls hacked using recently patched bugs
summary: Hackers have already compromised thousands of Palo Alto Networks firewalls in attacks exploiting two recently patched zero-day vulnerabilities.

title: CISA says BianLian ransomware now focuses only on data theft
summary: The BianLian ransomware operation has shifted its tactics, becoming primarily a data theft extortion group, according to an updated advisory from the U.S. Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency, the FBI, and the Australian Cyber Security Centre.

title: Microsoft disrupts ONNX phishing-as-a-service infrastructure
summary: ​Microsoft has seized 240 domains used by customers of ONNX, a phishing-as-a-service (PhaaS) platform, to target companies and individuals across the United States and worldwide since at least 2017.

title: Fortinet VPN design flaw hides successful brute-force attacks
summary: A design flaw in the Fortinet VPN server's logging mechanism can be leveraged to conceal the successful verification of credentials during a brute-force attack without tipping off defenders of compromised logins.

title: Now BlueSky hit with crypto scams as it crosses 20 million users
summary: As users are flocking to BlueSky from social media platforms like X/Twitter, so are threat actors. BleepingComputer has spotted cryptocurrency scams popping up on BlueSky just as the decentralized microblogging service surpassed 20 million users this week.

title: Cyberattack at French hospital exposes health data of 750,000 patients
summary: A data breach at an unnamed French hospital exposed the medical records of 750,000 patients after a threat actor gained access to its electronic patient record system.

title: Fintech giant Finastra investigates data breach after SFTP hack
summary: Finastra has confirmed it warned customers of a cybersecurity incident after a threat actor began selling allegedly stolen data on a hacking forum.

title: MITRE shares 2024's top 25 most dangerous software weaknesses
summary: MITRE has shared this year's top 25 list of the most common and dangerous software weaknesses behind more than 31,000 vulnerabilities disclosed between June 2023 and June 2024.

title: US charges five linked to Scattered Spider cybercrime gang
summary: The U.S. Justice Department has charged five suspects believed to be part of the financially motivated Scattered Spider cybercrime gang with conspiracy to commit wire fraud.

title: Ubuntu Linux impacted by decade-old 'needrestart' flaw that gives root
summary: Five local privilege escalation (LPE) vulnerabilities have been discovered in the needrestart utility used by Ubuntu Linux, which was introduced over 10 years ago in version 21.04.

title: New Ghost Tap attack abuses NFC mobile payments to steal money
summary: Cybercriminals have devised a novel method to cash out from stolen credit card details linked to mobile payment systems such as Apple Pay and Google Pay, dubbed 'Ghost Tap,' which relays NFC card data to money mules worldwide.

title: Amazon and Audible flooded with 'forex trading' and warez listings
summary: Amazon, Amazon Music, and Audible, an Amazon-owned online audiobook and podcast service, have been flooded with bogus listings that push dubious "forex trading" sites, Telegram channels, and suspicious links claiming to offer pirated software.

title: Apple fixes two zero-days used in attacks on Intel-based Macs
summary: Apple released emergency security updates to fix two zero-day vulnerabilities that were exploited in attacks on Intel-based Mac systems.

title: CISA tags Progress Kemp LoadMaster flaw as exploited in attacks
summary: The U.S. Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added three new flaws in its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, including a critical OS command injection impacting Progress Kemp LoadMaster.

title: Ford rejects breach allegations, says customer data not impacted
summary: Ford is investigating allegations that it suffered a data breach after a threat actor claimed to leak 44,000 customer records on a hacking forum.

title: Oracle warns of Agile PLM file disclosure flaw exploited in attacks
summary: Oracle has fixed an unauthenticated file disclosure flaw in Oracle Agile Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) tracked as CVE-2024-21287, which was actively exploited as a zero-day to download files.

title: D-Link urges users to retire VPN routers impacted by unfixed RCE flaw
summary: D-Link is warning customers to replace end-of-life VPN router models after a critical unauthenticated, remote code execution vulnerability was discovered that will not be fixed on these devices.

title: Helldown ransomware exploits Zyxel VPN flaw to breach networks
summary: The new 'Helldown' ransomware operation is believed to target vulnerabilities in Zyxel firewalls to breach corporate networks, allowing them to steal data and encrypt devices.

title: Botnet fueling residential proxies disrupted in cybercrime crackdown
summary: The Ngioweb botnet, which supplies most of the 35,000 bots in the cybercriminal NSOCKS proxy service, is being disrupted as security companies block traffic to and from the two networks.

title: Microsoft launches Zero Day Quest hacking event with $4 million in rewards
summary: ​Microsoft announced today at its Ignite annual conference in Chicago, Illinois, that it's expanding its bug bounty programs with Zero Day Quest, a new hacking event focusing on cloud and AI products and platforms.

title: Microsoft shares more details on Windows 11 admin protection
summary: ​Microsoft has shared more details about the new Windows 11 administrator protection security feature, which is available in preview and uses Windows Hello authentication prompts to block access to critical system resources.

title: Spotify abused to promote pirated software and game cheats
summary: Spotify playlists and podcasts are being abused to push pirated software, game cheat codes, spam links, and "warez" sites. By injecting targeted keywords and links in playlist names and podcast descriptions, threat actors may benefit from boosting SEO for their dubious online properties appearing in Google.

title: Brave on iOS adds new "Shred" button to wipe site-specific data
summary: Brave Browser 1.71 for iOS introduces a new privacy-focused feature called "Shred," which allows users to easily delete site-specific mobile browsing data.

title: Chinese hackers exploit Fortinet VPN zero-day to steal credentials
summary: Chinese threat actors use a custom post-exploitation toolkit named 'DeepData' to exploit a zero-day vulnerability in Fortinet's FortiClient Windows VPN client that steal credentials.

title: US space tech giant Maxar discloses employee data breach
summary: Hackers breached U.S. satellite maker Maxar Space Systems and accessed personal data belonging to its employees, the company informs in a notification to impacted individuals.

title: Palo Alto Networks patches two firewall zero-days used in attacks
summary: Palo Alto Networks has finally released security updates for an actively exploited zero-day vulnerability in its Next-Generation Firewalls (NGFW).

title: US charges Phobos ransomware admin after South Korea extradition
summary: Evgenii Ptitsyn, a Russian national and suspected administrator of the Phobos ransomware operation, was extradited from South Korea and is facing cybercrime charges in the United States.

title: Critical RCE bug in VMware vCenter Server now exploited in attacks
summary: ​Broadcom warned today that attackers are now exploiting two VMware vCenter Server vulnerabilities, one of which is a critical remote code execution flaw.

title: Fake Bitwarden ads on Facebook push info-stealing Chrome extension
summary: Fake Bitwarden password manager advertisements on Facebook are pushing a malicious Google Chrome extension that collects and steals sensitive user data from the browser.

title: Microsoft 365 Admin portal abused to send sextortion emails
summary: The Microsoft 365 Admin Portal is being abused to send sextortion emails, making the emails appear trustworthy and bypassing email security platforms.

title: Phishing emails increasingly use SVG attachments to evade detection
summary: Threat actors increasingly use Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) attachments to display phishing forms or deploy malware while evading detection.

title: Security plugin flaw in millions of WordPress sites gives admin access
summary: A critical authentication bypass vulnerability has been discovered impacting the WordPress plugin 'Really Simple Security' (formerly 'Really Simple SSL'), including both free and Pro versions.

title: Fake AI video generators infect Windows, macOS with infostealers
summary: Fake AI image and video generators infect Windows and macOS with the Lumma Stealer and AMOS information-stealing malware, used to steal credentials and cryptocurrency wallets from infected devices.

title: T-Mobile confirms it was hacked in recent wave of telecom breaches
summary: T-Mobile confirms it was hacked in the wave of recently reported telecom breaches conducted by Chinese threat actors to gain access to private communications, call records, and law enforcement information requests.

title: GitHub projects targeted with malicious commits to frame researcher
summary: GitHub projects have been targeted with malicious commits and pull requests, in an attempt to inject backdoors into these projects. Most recently, the GitHub repository of Exo Labs, an AI and machine learning startup, was targeted in the attack, which has left many wondering about the attacker's true intentions.

title: NSO Group used another WhatsApp zero-day after being sued, court docs say
summary: Israeli surveillance firm NSO Group reportedly used multiple zero-day exploits, including an unknown one named "Erised," that leveraged WhatsApp vulnerabilities to deploy Pegasus spyware in zero-click attacks, even after getting sued.

title: Botnet exploits GeoVision zero-day to install Mirai malware
summary: A malware botnet is exploiting a zero-day vulnerability in end-of-life GeoVision devices to compromise and recruit them for likely DDoS or cryptomining attacks.

title: FTC reports 50% drop in unwanted call complaints since 2021
summary: On Friday, the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) reported that the number of consumer complaints about unwanted telemarketing phone calls has dropped over 50% since 2021, continuing a trend that started three years ago.

title: Bitfinex hacker gets 5 years in prison for 120,000 bitcoin heist
summary: A hacker responsible for stealing 119,754 Bitcoin in a 2016 hack on the Bitfinex cryptocurrency exchange was sentenced to five years in prison by U.S. authorities.

title: Microsoft pulls Exchange security updates over mail delivery issues
summary: Microsoft has pulled the November 2024 Exchange security updates released during this month's Patch Tuesday because of email delivery issues on servers using custom mail flow rules.

title: Palo Alto Networks warns of critical RCE zero-day exploited in attacks
summary: Palo Alto Networks is warning that a critical zero-day vulnerability on Next-Generation Firewalls (NGFW) management interfaces, currently tracked as 'PAN-SA-2024-0015,' is actively being exploited in attacks.

title: Fraud network uses 4,700 fake shopping sites to steal credit cards
summary: A financially motivated Chinese threat actor dubbed "SilkSpecter" is using thousands of fake online stores to steal the payment card details of online shoppers in the U.S. and Europe.

title: CISA warns of more Palo Alto Networks bugs exploited in attacks
summary: CISA warned today that two more critical security vulnerabilities in Palo Alto Networks' Expedition migration tool are now actively exploited in attacks.

title: New Glove infostealer malware bypasses Chrome’s cookie encryption
summary: ​New Glove Stealer information-stealing malware can bypass Google Chrome's Application-Bound (App-Bound) encryption to steal browser cookies.

title: Hacker gets 10 years in prison for extorting US healthcare provider
summary: Robert Purbeck, a 45-year-old man from Idaho, has been sentenced to ten years in prison for hacking at least 19 organizations in the United States, stealing the personal data of more than 132,000 people, and multiple extortion attempts.

title: ChatGPT allows access to underlying sandbox OS, “playbook” data
summary: OpenAI's containerized ChatGPT environment is open to limited yet extensive access to core instructions while allowing arbitrary file uploads and command execution within the isolated sandbox.

title: The true (and surprising) cost of forgotten passwords
summary: Password resets are more expensive for your organization than you may realize. Learn more from Specops Software on why password resets are so expensive and how a self-service password reset solution can save you money.

title: Hackers use macOS extended file attributes to hide malicious code
summary: Hackers are using a novel technique that abuses extended attributes for macOS files to deliver a new trojan that researchers call RustyAttr.

title: US govt officials’ communications compromised in recent telecom hack
summary: CISA and the FBI confirmed that Chinese hackers compromised the "private communications" of a "limited number" of government officials after breaching multiple U.S. broadband providers.

title: Leaked info of 122 million linked to B2B data aggregator breach
summary: The business contact information for 122 million people circulating since February 2024 is now confirmed to have been stolen from a B2B demand generation platform.

title: Microsoft patches Windows zero-day exploited in attacks on Ukraine
summary: Suspected Russian hackers were caught exploiting a recently patched Windows vulnerability as a zero-day in ongoing attacks targeting Ukrainian entities.

title: US indicts Snowflake hackers who extorted $2.5 million from 3 victims
summary: The Department of Justice has unsealed the indictment against two suspected Snowflake hackers, who breached more than 165 organizations using the services of the Snowflake cloud storage company.

title: Critical bug in EoL D-Link NAS devices now exploited in attacks
summary: ​Attackers now target a critical severity vulnerability with publicly available exploit code that affects multiple models of end-of-life D-Link network-attached storage (NAS) devices.

title: New Google Pixel AI feature analyzes phone conversations for scams
summary: Google is adding a new AI-powered scam protection feature that monitors phone call conversations on Google Pixel devices to detect patterns that warn when the caller may be a scammer.

title: New ShrinkLocker ransomware decryptor recovers BitLocker password
summary: Bitdefender has released a decryptor for the 'ShrinkLocker' ransomware strain, which uses Windows' built-in BitLocker drive encryption tool to lock victim's files.

title: Microsoft Exchange adds warning to emails abusing spoofing flaw
summary: Microsoft has disclosed a high-severity Exchange Server vulnerability that allows attackers to forge legitimate senders on incoming emails and make malicious messages a lot more effective.

title: D-Link won’t fix critical bug in 60,000 exposed EoL modems
summary: Tens of thousands of exposed D-Link routers that have reached their end-of-life are vulnerable to a critical security issue that allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to change any user's password and take complete control of the device.

title: Windows 10 KB5046613 update released with fixes for printer bugs
summary: Microsoft has released the KB5046613 cumulative update for Windows 10 22H2 and Windows 10 21H2, which includes ten changes and fixes, including the new Microsoft account manager on the Start menu and fixes for multi-function printer issues.

title: Microsoft November 2024 Patch Tuesday fixes 4 zero-days, 89 flaws
summary: Today is Microsoft's November 2024 Patch Tuesday, which includes security updates for 89 flaws, including four zero-days, two of which are actively exploited.

title: Signal introduces convenient "call links" for private group chats
summary: The Signal messenger application has announced a set of new features aimed at making private group chats more convenient and easier for people to join.

title: FBI, CISA, and NSA reveal most exploited vulnerabilities of 2023
summary: ​The FBI, the NSA, and Five Eyes cybersecurity authorities have released a list of the top 15 routinely exploited vulnerabilities throughout last year, most of them first abused as zero-days.

title: Volt Typhoon rebuilds malware botnet following FBI disruption
summary: The Chinese state-sponsored hacking group Volt Typhoon has begun to rebuild its "KV-Botnet" malware botnet after it was disrupted by law enforcement in January, according to researchers from SecurityScorecard.

title: North Korean hackers create Flutter apps to bypass macOS security
summary: North Korean threat actors target Apple macOS systems using trojanized Notepad apps and minesweeper games created with Flutter, which are signed and notarized by legitimate Apple developer IDs.

title: iPhones now auto-restart to block access to encrypted data after long idle times
summary: Apple has added a new security feature with the iOS 18.1 update released last month to ensure that iPhones automatically reboot after long idle periods to re-encrypt data and make it harder to extract.

title: New Ymir ransomware partners with RustyStealer in attacks
summary: A new ransomware family called 'Ymir' has been spotted in the wild, being introduced onto systems that were previously compromised by the RustyStealer info-stealer malware.

title: HIBP notifies 57 million people of Hot Topic data breach
summary: Have I Been Pwned warns that an alleged data breach exposed the personal information of 56,904,909 accounts for Hot Topic, Box Lunch, and Torrid customers.

title: Amazon confirms employee data breach after vendor hack
summary: Amazon confirmed a data breach involving employee information after data allegedly stolen during the May 2023 MOVEit attacks was leaked on a hacking forum.

title: Halliburton reports $35 million loss after ransomware attack
summary: Halliburton has revealed that an August ransomware attack has led to $35 million in losses after the breach caused the company to shut down IT systems and disconnect customers.

title: Hackers now use ZIP file concatenation to evade detection
summary: Hackers are targeting Windows machines using the ZIP file concatenation technique to deliver malicious payloads in compressed archives without security solutions detecting them.

title: Scammers target UK senior citizens with Winter Fuel Payment texts
summary: As the winter season kicks in, scammers are not missing the chance to target senior British residents with bogus "winter heating allowance" and "cost of living support" scam texts.

title: Malicious PyPI package with 37,000 downloads steals AWS keys
summary: A malicious Python package named 'fabrice' has been present in the Python Package Index (PyPI) since 2021, stealing Amazon Web Services credentials from unsuspecting developers.

title: Critical Veeam RCE bug now used in Frag ransomware attacks
summary: After being used in Akira and Fog ransomware attacks, a critical Veeam Backup & Replication (VBR) security flaw was also recently exploited to deploy Frag ransomware.

title: D-Link won’t fix critical flaw affecting 60,000 older NAS devices
summary: More than 60,000 D-Link network-attached storage devices that have reached end-of-life are vulnerable to a command injection vulnerability with a publicly available exploit.

title: Unpatched Mazda Connect bugs let hackers install persistent malware
summary: Attackers could exploit several vulnerabilities in the Mazda Connect infotainment unit, present in multiple car models including Mazda 3 (2014-2021), to execute arbitrary code with root permission.

title: Palo Alto Networks warns of potential PAN-OS RCE vulnerability
summary: Palo Alto Networks warned customers to restrict access to their next-generation firewalls because of a potential remote code execution vulnerability in the PAN-OS management interface.

title: Google's mysterious 'search.app' links leave Android users concerned
summary: The most recent update to the Google Android app has startled users as they notice the mysterious "search.app" links being generated when sharing content and links from the Google app externally.

title: North Korean hackers use new macOS malware against crypto firms
summary: North Korean threat actor BlueNoroff has been targeting crypto-related businesses with a new multi-stage malware for macOS systems.

title: CISA warns of critical Palo Alto Networks bug exploited in attacks
summary: Today, CISA warned that attackers are exploiting a critical missing authentication vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks Expedition, a migration tool that can help convert firewall configuration from Checkpoint, Cisco, and other vendors to PAN-OS.

title: Nokia says hackers leaked third-party app source code
summary: Nokia's investigation of recent claims of a data breach found that the source code leaked on a hacker forum belongs to a third party and company and customer data has not been impacted.

title: Canada orders TikTok to shut down over national risk concerns
summary: The Canadian government has ordered the dissolution of TikTok Technology Canada following a multi-step review that provided information and evidence of the social media company posing a national risk.

title: HPE warns of critical RCE flaws in Aruba Networking access points
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) released updates for Instant AOS-8 and AOS-10 software to address two critical vulnerabilities in Aruba Networking Access Points.

title: Hackers increasingly use Winos4.0 post-exploitation kit in attacks
summary: Hackers are increasingly targeting Windows users with the malicious Winos4.0 framework, distributed via seemingly benign game-related apps.

title: Cisco bug lets hackers run commands as root on UWRB access points
summary: Cisco has fixed a maximum severity vulnerability that allows attackers to run commands with root privileges on vulnerable Ultra-Reliable Wireless Backhaul (URWB) access points that provide connectivity for industrial wireless automation.

title: New SteelFox malware hijacks Windows PCs using vulnerable driver
summary: A new malicious package called 'SteelFox' mines for cryptocurrency and steals credit card data by using the "bring your own vulnerable driver" technique to get SYSTEM privileges on Windows machines.

title: Washington courts' systems offline following weekend cyberattack
summary: ​​Court systems across Washington state have been down since Sunday when officials said "unauthorized activity" was detected on their networks.

title: Germany drafts law to protect researchers who find security flaws
summary: The Federal Ministry of Justice in Germany has drafted a law to provide legal protection to security researchers who discover and responsibly report security vulnerabilities to vendors.

title: Google Cloud to make MFA mandatory by the end of 2025
summary: Google has announced that multi-factor authentication (MFA) will be mandatory on all Cloud accounts by the end of 2025 to enhance security.

title: Interpol disrupts cybercrime activity on 22,000 IP addresses, arrests 41
summary: Interpol announced it arrested 41 individuals and taken down 1,037 servers and infrastructure running on 22,000 IP addresses facilitating cybercrime in an international law enforcement action titled Operation Synergia II.

title: US warns of last-minute Iranian and Russian election influence ops
summary: The U.S. Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency is warning about last-minute influence operations conducted by Iranian and Russian actors to undermine the public trust in the integrity and fairness of the upcoming presidential election.

title: Suspect behind Snowflake data-theft attacks arrested in Canada
summary: Canadian authorities have arrested a man suspected of having stolen the data of hundreds of millions after targeting over 165 organizations, all of them customers of cloud storage company Snowflake.

title: Google fixes two Android zero-days used in targeted attacks
summary: Google fixed two actively exploited Android zero-day flaws as part of its November security updates, addressing a total of 51 vulnerabilities.

title: Nokia investigates breach after hacker claims to steal source code
summary: Nokia is investigating whether a third-party vendor was breached after a hacker claimed to be selling the company's stolen source code.

title: DocuSign's Envelopes API abused to send realistic fake invoices
summary: Threat actors are abusing DocuSign's Envelopes API to create and mass-distribute fake invoices that appear genuine, impersonating well-known brands like Norton and PayPal.

title: Schneider Electric confirms dev platform breach after hacker steals data
summary: Schneider Electric has confirmed a developer platform was breached after a threat actor claimed to steal 40GB of data from the company's JIRA server.

title: Custom "Pygmy Goat" malware used in Sophos Firewall hack on govt network
summary: UK's National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) has published an analysis of a Linux malware named "Pigmy Goat" created to backdoor Sophos XG firewall devices as part of recently disclosed attacks by Chinese threat actors.

title: Windows infected with backdoored Linux VMs in new phishing attacks
summary: A new phishing campaign dubbed 'CRON#TRAP' infects Windows with a Linux virtual machine that contains a built-in backdoor to give stealthy access to corporate networks.

title: Solving the painful password problem with better policies
summary: Weak and reused credentials continue to plague users and organizations. Learn from Specops software about why passwords are so easy to hack and how organizations can fortify their security efforts.

title: City of Columbus: Data of 500,000 stolen in July ransomware attack
summary: ​The City of Columbus, Ohio, notified 500,000 individuals that a ransomware gang stole their personal and financial information in a July 2024 cyberattack.

title: Cisco says DevHub site leak won’t enable future breaches
summary: ​Cisco says that non-public files recently downloaded by a threat actor from a misconfigured public-facing DevHub portal don't contain information that could be exploited in future breaches of the company's systems.

title: Meet Interlock — The new ransomware targeting FreeBSD servers
summary: A relatively new ransomware operation named Interlock attacks organizations worldwide, taking the unusual approach of creating an encryptor to target FreeBSD servers.

title: ChatGPT-4o can be used for autonomous voice-based scams
summary: Researchers have shown that it's possible to abuse OpenAI's real-time voice API for ChatGPT-4o, an advanced LLM chatbot, to conduct financial scams with low to moderate success rates.

title: Microsoft SharePoint RCE bug exploited to breach corporate network
summary: A recently disclosed Microsoft SharePoint remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-38094 is being exploited to gain initial access to corporate networks.

title: LA housing authority confirms breach claimed by Cactus ransomware
summary: The Housing Authority of the City of Los Angeles (HACLA), one of the largest public housing authorities in the United States, confirmed that a cyberattack hit its IT network after recent breach claims from the Cactus ransomware gang.

title: OpenAI's new ChatGPT Search Chrome extension feels like a search hijacker
summary: OpenAI's new "ChatGPT search" Chrome extension feels like nothing more than a typical search hijacker, changing Chrome's settings so your address bar searches go through ChatGPT Search instead.

title: LastPass warns of fake support centers trying to steal customer data
summary: LastPass is warning about an ongoing campaign where scammers are writing reviews for its Chrome extension to promote a fake customer support phone number. However, this phone number is part of a much larger campaign to trick callers into giving scammers remote access to their computers, as discovered by BleepingComputer.

title: Synology hurries out patches for zero-days exploited at Pwn2Own
summary: Synology, a Taiwanese network-attached storage (NAS) appliance maker, patched two critical zero-days exploited during last week's Pwn2Own hacking competition within days.

title: DDoS site Dstat.cc seized and two suspects arrested in Germany
summary: The Dstat.cc DDoS review platform has been seized by law enforcement, and two suspects have been arrested after the service helped fuel distributed denial-of-service attacks for years.

title: Sophos reveals 5-year battle with Chinese hackers attacking network devices
summary: Sophos disclosed today a series of reports dubbed "Pacific Rim" that detail how the cybersecurity company has been sparring with Chinese threat actors for over 5 years as they increasingly targeted networking devices worldwide, including those from Sophos.

title: Microsoft: Chinese hackers use Quad7 botnet to steal credentials
summary: Microsoft warns that Chinese threat actors use the Quad7 botnet, compromised of hacked SOHO routers, to steal credentials in password-spray attacks.

title: Hackers target critical zero-day vulnerability in PTZ cameras
summary: Hackers are attempting to exploit two zero-day vulnerabilities in PTZOptics pan-tilt-zoom (PTZ) live streaming cameras used in industrial, healthcare, business conferences, government, and courtroom settings.

title: Microsoft wants $30 if you want to delay Windows 11 switch
summary: ​Microsoft announced today that Windows 10 home users can delay the switch to Windows 11 for one more year if they're willing to pay $30 for Extended Security Updates (ESU).

title: LiteSpeed Cache WordPress plugin bug lets hackers get admin access
summary: The free version of the popular WordPress plugin LiteSpeed Cache has fixed a dangerous privilege elevation flaw on its latest release that could allow unauthenticated site visitors to gain admin rights.

title: qBittorrent fixes flaw exposing users to MitM attacks for 14 years
summary: qBittorrent has addressed a remote code execution flaw caused by the failure to validate SSL/TLS certificates in the application's DownloadManager, a component that manages downloads throughout the app.

title: Over a thousand online shops hacked to show fake product listings
summary: A phishing campaign dubbed 'Phish n' Ships' has been underway since at least 2019, infecting over a thousand legitimate online stores to promote fake product listings for hard-to-find items.

title: Cynet delivers 426% ROI in Forrester Total Economic Impact Study
summary: A commissioned study conducted by Forrester Consulting on behalf of Cynet in October 2024 found that Cynet's All-in-One Cybersecurity Platform generated $2.73 million in savings, paying for itself in under six months, for a return on investment of 426%.

title: LottieFiles hacked in supply chain attack to steal users’ crypto
summary: The popular LottieFiles Lotti-Player project was compromised in a supply chain attack to inject a crypto drainer into websites that steals visitors' cryptocurrency.

title: Interbank confirms data breach following failed extortion, data leak
summary: ​Interbank, one of Peru's leading financial institutions, has confirmed a data breach after a threat actor who hacked into its systems leaked stolen data online.

title: QNAP patches second zero-day exploited at Pwn2Own to get root
summary: QNAP has fixed a second zero-day vulnerability exploited at the Pwn2Own Ireland 2024 hacking contest to gain a root shell and take over a TS-464 NAS device.

title: North Korean govt hackers linked to Play ransomware attack
summary: The North Korean state-sponsored hacking group tracked as 'Andariel' has been linked to the Play ransomware operation, using the RaaS to work behind the scenes and evade sanctions.

title: Android malware "FakeCall" now reroutes bank calls to attackers
summary: A new version of the FakeCall malware for Android hijacks outgoing calls from a user to their bank, redirecting them to the attacker's phone number instead.

title: Hackers steal 15,000 cloud credentials from exposed Git config files
summary: A global large-scale dubbed "EmeraldWhale" exploited misconfigured Git configuration files to steal over 15,000 cloud account credentials from thousands of private repositories.

title: FBI: Upcoming U.S. general election fuel multiple fraud schemes
summary: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) is warning of multiple schemes taking advantage of the upcoming U.S. general election to scam people out of their money or personal data.

title: New Windows Themes zero-day gets free, unofficial patches
summary: Free unofficial patches are now available for a new Windows Themes zero-day vulnerability that allows attackers to steal a target's NTLM credentials remotely.

title: Massive PSAUX ransomware attack targets 22,000 CyberPanel instances
summary: Over 22,000 CyberPanel instances exposed online to a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability were mass-targeted in a PSAUX ransomware attack that took almost all instances offline.

title: QNAP fixes NAS backup software zero-day exploited at Pwn2Own
summary: QNAP has fixed a critical zero-day vulnerability exploited by security researchers on Thursday to hack a TS-464 NAS device during the Pwn2Own Ireland 2024 competition.

title: Russian charged by U.S. for creating RedLine infostealer malware
summary: The United States announced charges today against Maxim Rudometov, a Russian national, for being the suspected developer and administrator of the RedLine malware operation, one of the most prolific infostealers over the past few years.

title: New tool bypasses Google Chrome’s new cookie encryption system
summary: A researcher has released a tool to bypass Google's new App-Bound encryption cookie-theft defenses and extract saved credentials from the Chrome web browser.

title: Russia targets Ukrainian conscripts with Windows, Android malware
summary: A hybrid espionage/influence campaign conducted by the Russian threat group 'UNC5812' has been uncovered, targeting Ukrainian military recruits with Windows and Android malware.

title: Free, France’s second largest ISP, confirms data breach after leak
summary: Free, a major internet service provider (ISP) in France, confirmed over the weekend that hackers breached its systems and stole customer personal information.

title: US says Chinese hackers breached multiple telecom providers
summary: The FBI and the U.S. Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) have disclosed that Chinese hackers breached commercial telecommunication service providers in the United States.

title: Redline, Meta infostealer malware operations seized by police
summary: The Dutch National Police seized the network infrastructure for the Redline and Meta infostealer malware operations in "Operation Magnus," warning cybercriminals that their data is now in the hands of law enforcement.

title: Fog ransomware targets SonicWall VPNs to breach corporate networks
summary: Fog and Akira ransomware operators have increased their exploitation efforts of CVE-2024-40766, a critical access control flaw that allows unauthorized access to resources on the SSL VPN feature of SonicWall SonicOS firewalls.

title: New Cisco ASA and FTD features block VPN brute-force password attacks

title: Over 70 zero-day flaws get hackers $1 million at Pwn2Own Ireland
summary: The fourth day of Pwn2Own Ireland 2024 marked the end of the hacking competition with more than $1 million in prizes for over 70 unique zero-day vulnerabilities in fully patched devices.

title: Black Basta ransomware poses as IT support on Microsoft Teams to breach networks

title: Russia sentences REvil ransomware members to over 4 years in prison
summary: Russia has sentenced four members of the REvil ransomware operation to over 4 years in prison for distributing malware and illegal circulation of means of payment.

title: Amazon seizes domains used in rogue Remote Desktop campaign to steal data
summary: Amazon has seized domains used by the Russian APT29 hacking group in targeted attacks against government and military organizations to steal Windows credentials and data using malicious Remote Desktop Protocol connection files.

title: QNAP, Synology, Lexmark devices hacked on Pwn2Own Day 3
summary: The third day of Pwn2Own Ireland 2024 continued to showcase the expertise of white hat hackers as they exposed 11 zero-day vulnerabilities, adding $124,750 to the total prize pool, which now stands at $874,875.

title: UnitedHealth says data of 100 million stolen in Change Healthcare breach
summary: UnitedHealth has confirmed for the first time that over 100 million people had their personal information and healthcare data stolen in the Change Healthcare ransomware attack, marking this as the largest healthcare data breach in recent years.

title: Apple creates Private Cloud Compute VM to let researchers find bugs

summary: Henry Schein has finally disclosed a data breach following at least two back-to-back cyberattacks in 2023 by the BlackCat Ransomware gang, revealing that over 160,000 people had their personal information stolen.

title: Insurance admin Landmark says data breach impacts 800,000 people
summary: Insurance administrative services company Landmark Admin warns that a data breach impacts over 800,000 people from a May cyberattack.

title: Cisco fixes VPN DoS flaw discovered in password spray attacks
summary: Cisco fixed a denial of service flaw in its Cisco ASA and Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) software, which was discovered during large-scale brute force attacks against Cisco VPN devices in April.

title: New Qilin ransomware encryptor features stronger encryption, evasion

title: Samsung Galaxy S24 and Sonos Era hacked on Pwn2Own Ireland Day 2
summary: On the second day of Pwn2Own Ireland 2024, competing white hat hackers showcased an impressive 51 zero-day vulnerabilities, earning a total of $358,625 in cash prizes.

title: Mandiant says new Fortinet flaw has been exploited since June
summary: A new Fortinet FortiManager flaw dubbed "FortiJump" and tracked as CVE-2024-47575 has been exploited since June 2024 in zero-day attacks on over 50 servers, according to a new report by Mandiant.

title: WhatsApp now encrypts contact databases for privacy-preserving synching

title: Lazarus hackers used fake DeFi game to exploit Google Chrome zero-day

title: Google to let businesses create curated Chrome Web Stores for extensions

summary: Fortinet publicly disclosed today a critical FortiManager API vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-47575, that was exploited in zero-day attacks to steal sensitive files containing configurations, IP addresses, and credentials for managed devices.

title: Hackers exploit 52 zero-days on the first day of Pwn2Own Ireland
summary: On the first day of Pwn2Own Ireland, participants demonstrated 52 zero-day vulnerabilities across a range of devices, earning a total of $486,250 in cash prizes.

title: CISA proposes new security requirements to protect govt, personal data

title: AWS, Azure auth keys found in Android and iOS apps used by millions

title: SEC charges tech companies for downplaying SolarWinds breaches

title: Bumblebee malware returns after recent law enforcement disruption

title: Tech giant Nidec confirms data breach following ransomware attack
summary: Nidec Corporation is informing that hackers behind a ransomware attack is suffered earlier this year stole data and leaked it on the dark web.

title: Intel, AMD CPUs on Linux impacted by newly disclosed Spectre bypass

summary: In 2024, the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) launched the K-12 Cybersecurity Pilot Program, a groundbreaking initiative backed by $200 million in funding. Learn more from Cynet about how schools and libraries can apply to this program.

title: Hackers blackmail Globe Life after stealing customer data

title: Understand these seven password attacks and how to stop them

title: EDRSilencer red team tool used in attacks to bypass security

title: Underground ransomware claims attack on Casio, leaks stolen data

title: GitLab warns of critical arbitrary branch pipeline execution flaw

title: CISA says critical Fortinet RCE flaw now exploited in attacks
summary: Today, CISA revealed that attackers actively exploit a critical FortiOS remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in the wild.

title: Crypto-stealing malware campaign infects 28,000 people

title: Palo Alto Networks warns of firewall hijack bugs with public exploit

title: Recent Dr.Web cyberattack claimed by pro-Ukrainian hacktivists

title: Ivanti warns of three more CSA zero-days exploited in attacks
summary: American IT software company Ivanti has released security updates to fix three new Cloud Services Appliance (CSA) zero-days tagged as actively exploited in attacks.

title: European govt air-gapped systems breached using custom malware
summary: An APT hacking group known as GoldenJackal has successfully breached air-gapped government systems in Europe using two custom toolsets to steal sensitive data, like emails, encryption keys, images, archives, and documents.

title: Casio reports IT systems failure after weekend network breach
summary: Japanese tech giant Casio has suffered a cyberattack after an unauthorized actor accessed its networks on October 5, causing system disruption that impacted some of its services.

title: MoneyGram confirms hackers stole customer data in cyberattack

title: ADT discloses second breach in 2 months, hacked via stolen credentials

title: LEGO's website hacked to push cryptocurrency scam
summary: On Friday night, cryptocurrency scammers briefly hacked the LEGO website to promote a fake Lego token that could be purchased with Ethereum.

title: Ukrainian pleads guilty to operating Raccoon Stealer malware
summary: Ukrainian national Mark Sokolovsky has pleaded guilty to his involvement in the Raccoon Stealer malware-as-a-service (MaaS) cybercrime operation.

title: Qualcomm patches high-severity zero-day exploited in attacks
summary: Qualcomm has released security patches for a zero-day vulnerability in the Digital Signal Processor (DSP) service that impacts dozens of chipsets.

title: American Water shuts down online services after cyberattack
summary: American Water, the largest publicly traded U.S. water and wastewater utility company, was forced to shut down some of its systems after a Thursday cyberattack.

title: AT&T, Verizon reportedly hacked to target US govt wiretapping platform
summary: Multiple U.S. broadband providers, including Verizon, AT&T, and Lumen Technologies, have been breached by a Chinese hacking group tracked as Salt Typhoon, the Wall Street Journal reports.

title: Hybrid Analysis Bolstered by Criminal IP’s Comprehensive Domain Intelligence
summary: AI SPERA announced that its domain and IP address threat intel platform, Criminal IP, is now integrated with Hybrid Analysis. Learn more from Criminal IP about how this brings additional insights to Hybrid Analysis.

title: Comcast and Truist Bank customers caught up in FBCS data breach
summary: Comcast Cable Communications and Truist Bank have disclosed they were impacted by a data breach at FBCS, and are now informing their respective customers that their data has been compromised.

title: Man pleads guilty to stealing $37 million in crypto from 571 victims

summary: Google Pay alarmed users this week after erroneously sending out "new card" added email notifications. Google has acknowledged that the email was "accidental" and that no user information was compromised.

title: MoneyGram: No evidence ransomware is behind recent cyberattack
summary: MoneyGram says there is no evidence that ransomware is behind a recent cyberattack that led to a five-day outage in September.

title: Highline Public Schools confirms ransomware behind shutdown
summary: On Thursday, K-12 school district Highline Public Schools confirmed that a ransomware attack forced it to shut down all schools in early September.

title: Russia arrests US-sanctioned Cryptex founder, 95 other linked suspects
summary: ​Russian law enforcement detained almost 100 suspects linked to the Cryptex cryptocurrency exchange, the UAPS anonymous payment service, and 33 other online services and platforms used to make illegal payments and sell stolen credentials.

title: Google removes Kaspersky's antivirus software from Play Store
summary: Over the weekend, Google removed Kaspersky's Android security apps from the Google Play store and disabled the Russian company's developer accounts.

title: Outlast game development delayed after Red Barrels cyberattack
summary: Canadian video game developer Red Barrels is warning that the development of its Outlast games will likely be delayed after the company suffered a cyberattack impacting its internal IT systems and data.

title: UK nuclear site Sellafield fined $440,000 for cybersecurity shortfalls

title: Recently patched CUPS flaw can be used to amplify DDoS attacks

title: ‘Pig butchering’ trading apps found on Google Play, App Store
summary: Fake trading apps on Google Play and Apple's App Store lure victims into "pig butchering" scams that have a global reach.

title: Dutch Police: ‘State actor’ likely behind recent data breach
summary: The national Dutch police (Politie) says that a state actor was likely behind the data breach it detected last week.

title: Microsoft and DOJ disrupt Russian FSB hackers' attack infrastructure

title: Over 4,000 Adobe Commerce, Magento shops hacked in CosmicSting attacks

title: Fraudsters imprisoned for scamming Apple out of 6,000 iPhones

title: Cloudflare blocks largest recorded DDoS attack peaking at 3.8Tbps

The assault consisted of a "month-long" barrage of more than 100 hyper-volumetric DDoS attacks flood.

title: Linux malware “perfctl” behind years-long cryptomining campaign
summary: A Linux malware named "perfctl" has been targeting Linux servers and workstations for at least three years, remaining largely undetected through high levels of evasion and the use of rootkits.

title: Why your password policy should include a custom dictionary wordlist

title: FIN7 hackers launch deepfake nude “generator” sites to spread malware

title: Critical Ivanti RCE flaw with public exploit now used in attacks

title: Fake browser updates spread updated WarmCookie malware
summary: A new 'FakeUpdate' campaign targeting users in France leverages compromised websites to show fake browser and application updates that spread a new version of the WarmCookie malware.

title: CISA: Network switch RCE flaw impacts critical infrastructure
summary: U.S. cybersecurity agency CISA is warning about two critical vulnerabilities that allow authentication bypass and remote code execution in Optigo Networks ONS-S8 Aggregation Switch products used in critical infrastructure.

title: Critical Zimbra RCE flaw exploited to backdoor servers using emails
summary: Hackers are actively exploiting a recently disclosed RCE vulnerability in Zimbra email servers that can be triggered simply by sending specially crafted emails to the SMTP server.

title: DrayTek fixed critical flaws in over 700,000 exposed routers
summary: DrayTek has released security updates for multiple router models to address 14 vulnerabilities of varying severity, including a remote code execution flaw that received the maximum CVSS score of 10.

title: Arc browser launches bug bounty program after fixing RCE bug
summary: The Browser Company has introduced an Arc Bug Bounty Program to encourage security researchers to report vulnerabilities to the project and receive rewards.

title: Rackspace monitoring data stolen in ScienceLogic zero-day attack
summary: Cloud hosting provider Rackspace suffered a data breach exposing "limited" customer monitoring data after threat actors exploited a zero-day vulnerability in a third-party tool used by the ScienceLogic SL1 platform.

title: Ransomware attack forces UMC Health System to divert some patients
summary: Texas healthcare provider UMC Health System was forced to divert some patients to other locations after a ransomware attack impacted its operations.

title: Evil Corp hit with new sanctions, BitPaymer ransomware charges
summary: The Evil Corp cybercrime syndicate has been hit with new sanctions by the United States, United Kingdom, and Australia. The US also indicted one of its members for conducting BitPaymer ransomware attacks.

title: Police arrest four suspects linked to LockBit ransomware gang
summary: Law enforcement authorities from 12 countries arrested four suspects linked to the LockBit ransomware gang, including a developer, a bulletproof hosting service administrator, and two people connected to LockBit activity.
